Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: K-OS
Reviews.Content: The good:Very small and lightweight camera.  Video is decent.  Sometimes you get the fish-eye effect but overall it's good.  Plenty of mounting options and you can pretty much put it anywhere.The bad:Menu system sucks.  You have to order the LCD backscreen to get any decent information on the menu options.  Without the screen, you're stuck with using cryptic abbreviations for the menu items.  I'm not sure why the camera didn't come with an LCD like 99% other cameras but it didn't.Must use the case in order to mount.  This can suck as the case ads some bulkiness to it.Manual doesn't explain how to use the mounts.  Needed to go to youtube.No way to save video in any format other than mpg4.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: mmcb
Reviews.Content: I bought the GoPro Hero Helmet cam for my kids for Christmas. They are all in their 20s and active so it is perfect. We ski every weekend so immediately took it on the slopes to try it out. It is remarkably accurate in its depiction of the real life experience. It has a wide angle so you see not only the snow ahead but the horizon and view beyond the skier. I was advised by a friend to get a camera with a wide angle lens and am very happy I did.It is extremely sturdy and comes with a couple of different ways to mount it. I put the strap on my helmet so that we could switch off between the adhesive mount on my daughter's helmet and mine. Switching it is simple. It also attaches securely to the mounts. My only caution is that it is possible to fall hard enough to have the mount detach from the helmet. If you crash hard, be sure to check for the camera before moving on.We are going to have a lot of fun with this camera- winter and summer!

Reviews.Title: A great product for the money
Reviews.Author: Michael Vadvilavich
Reviews.Content: I bought the GoPro HD Motorsports HERO for track use in my race car after seeing them installed in several cars in the paddock this last year. Everyone I talked to liked them, and with a sub $300 price I figured it was worth a try. I installed it with the roll bar attachment option for a resent track day at Laguna Seca, and was very impressed by the picture quality. Set at 720p / 60fps, the video looked pretty darn close to in-car footage you see on a TV broadcast. The wide-angle lens showed the actions of the driver clearly as well as a nice view of the track. Colors are sharp and accurate, and the auto-focus worked very well. It's pretty easy to use once you get acustom to the simple two button operation with tiny LCD screen that only shows the settings. The case and mounting seem very sturdy, and battery life has been very good. If you purchase a 32gb card you'll have plenty of storage for a whole day at the track. My only two issues are that when you turn the unit back on to start a track session, you need to re-set the video settings to where you want it - it should just default to whatever your last setting was. Also, aiming the camera is a bit of a challenge since there is no viewfinder or LCD picture display. You kind of just point it straight out toward the windshield and hope for the best. Luckily with the wide angle lens, you would have to be pretty far out of line to not get a good viewing area. Personally, I'd give up a little size and pay an extra $50 for a small LCD screen on back for aiming. Overall, a pretty darn nice little camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Real HD in a small and light package
Reviews.Author: Mark L. Carson "Coder"
Reviews.Content: This little wonder works as specified. I use it to shoot full 1080 HD (1920x1080) video at 30 fps. Produces nice output. It is small and lightweight and the Motorsports package I ordered comes with lots of mounts. So far I have used the suction cup mount (on the side of my car) and the optional head strap. Both of which work fine.Some issues worth noting:* Even with the (recommended) open back, there is more wind noise while driving than I would like.* There is no external microphone jack (in which case I would plug in a wind shielded mic)* The icons on the front (for setting video vice still camera mode, etc.) are very small and hard to read.* It does not come with any internal memory or an included SD card. So be sure to order some memory when you buy this video camera.I have driven in the rain (with the closed housing back) and the case protects the camera just fine.There is no video editing software included and Microsoft MovieMaker is a joke for editing video. So I purchased Pinnacle Studio HD (about $50) which is great for my editing needs (cutting down sequences, combining videos, adding titles, scene transitions, etc.).

Reviews.Title: Outdated product
Reviews.Author: Ponytail John
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my Son for Christmas.  It appears that this is a nearly obsolete product.  Support for this model has been all but removed from the company's website and he is finding it difficult to find supporting software.

Reviews.Title: Best action sports camera available (well, not anymore)...
Reviews.Author: Brandon Nimon "Brandon"
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible camera if you do any action sports and want to catch it on camera. It's surprisingly small (especially without the case), and light enough to be ignored in a lot of applications. I've used this while tubing behind a boat, water skiing and airchairing, jet skiing, shooting handguns/shotguns/rifles, SCUBA diving, hiking, swimming, cliff diving, traversing slot canyons, racing around the Nurburgring, and many other things. This camera is so flexible, it can go just about anywhere. There are purchasable options to secure the GoPro to just about anything, from headbands and helmets, to suction cups and roll cage attachments.The quality of the video is amazing for such a small camera. As my mom said when she first saw it, "It's like watching HDTV." Um, yeah. The 1080p video is spectacular. Color depth is fantastic, sharpness is great. The 5MP photos are adequate, and can be useful if being edited into a video, but not so much as a "high quality" still. I've never used 960p or 480p, so I can't speak for those, but 720p is also useful, for a couple reasons: 90% of the time, when I use 720p, I use 60FPS to get all the gritty detail for some good slow-mo footage, but there were a few times I've used 720p purely for it's 170-degree view. For really intense action sports, the wide angle gives you a much better view, and a more stable image. It's also nice using 720p along with the helmet cam, because it gives a close approximation of what the person's field of view actually is.It's got to be good, because national television networks are using the camera for regular footage! If you watch Discovery, History Channel, or MTV even a little, you will catch shots of the the GoPro all over the place, including shows like Mythbusters, One Man Army, and Nitro Circus. Professionals like Travis Pastrana and Tanner Foust use GoPros all the time to catch their stunts and showcase their equipment and teams.The problem I usually end up having is getting stuff on the lens of the waterproof case. I've had bug splatter, water spots, and saltwater residue; and flying rocks or just getting too friendly with abrasive objects have scratched the lens. Luckily some RainX helps prevent water spots, and lens replacements are cheap, and easy to replace. The problem is, I usually don't know until the end, or when I'm editing the video, that the lens was obscured.Things I wished were on this camera: an option to zoom in and out (independent of the resolution), option for a narrower field of view (more zoom), even higher frame rates, higher resolution stills, better low light capability, microphone input, and HDMI. Well, guess what. Only a few months after I got my HD Hero, the significantly improved HD Hero 2 is now out. And, it has ALL the things in my wish list! So what's a man to do? I guess owning 2 GoPros should have also been on my wish list.

Reviews.Title: Good but not Perfect! Yet...
Reviews.Author: Racer Guy
Reviews.Content: I just received my GoPro Motorsports Hero. I ordered it with a couple of extra batteries, the LCD BacPac and a 32GB SD card. Out of the box, be sure to insert the SD card into your PC and format it.  Go to GoPro's website and download the firmware update to the SD card if applicable. Fully insert the card into the GoPro. Follow the directions included with the camera to upload the update from the SD card to the camera. If you follow these steps, subsequent use of the camera is simple. I set the video resolution to 1080p and I'm pretty pleased with the quality of the recordings. The only reason I haven't given the camera 5 stars (as of the moment) is that the audio quality is extremely poor. I'll update my review as I use the camera. So far so good!Update 12/5/11After a few days of using the camera I realized I needed more than the 1 hour and 45 minutes of recording time that I was getting. I wasn't in a position to change the batteries, so I ordered the BacPac battery. There was an issue with the second battery working properly in the BacPac. I e-mailed customer service and the response from GoPro was excellent. They promptly replaced the defective part and shipped it back to me in a reasonable amount of time.I've now used the camera for a significant number of hours. The picture quality is outstanding for the price. The audio quality is acceptable - all things considered.I am very satisfied with the product. Please know that this camera is not for videoing your child's basketball games, birthday parties, weddings, or similar activities. You'll need to purchase something like the Sony HDR-CX160 for these types of activities (I have one of these Sonys - a different camera for different "missions"). The GoPro camera is specifically made for cycling, snowboarding, sky diving, motorcycles, auto racing, aviation cockpit recordings, and other similar applications. Given the excellent value when used in these specific types of events, I'm changing my rating from 4 to 5 stars. Knowing what I know now, I would definitely order this product again. Thanks GoPro!

Reviews.Title: Worth the Investment!
Reviews.Author: FrontPage
Reviews.Content: I saw the use of this little gem when I had to shoot ad-carrying airplanes on the eastern shore. Their company turned me onto the HD Hero camera and with the price being less than $400, I took the footage from their camera, showed it to my boss, and he ordered us two cameras.We cover motor sports, biking, and water events (both above and below, sometimes) and the GoPro HD is worth it. Because it helps you keep shooting. It had been frustrating to cover water based events, because we would have to shoot from the shore. But people are willing to mount this camera (or wear it) to give a POV perspective, albeit in fisheye. The fisheye view is never overplayed because we don't use it too often. When we need to, we welcome the fact that someone has made a camera that can shoot in WVGA, HD (720p, 960p in 4:3 aspect, as well as 1080p), will shoot in NTSC as well as PAL, and also can shoot stills and even act as a time lapse camera from 1 frame per second, to one every minute. This versatility is what people crave. But this camera even shoots in different frame rates from 30p to 60p which allows for slow motion. Put the footage into Motion or Final Cut Pro and you can tweak it to a super slow motion clip that looks great.It's small enough to fit a gynormous number of places, and the manufacturers seem intent on expanding the accessories which is a major plus for anyone interested in a GoPro. I just got the LCD screen which allows me to frame the camera better. The screen is powered by the battery but you can turn it on for framing and then turn it off since the LCD has its own power button (which is incorporated into a host of expanded rear covers). Add all of this, as well as the host of mounts for all different types of applications, and what should stop anyone interested in getting unique POV's from investing in this system? If you want to hate on it, that's your choice. But try putting any expensive camera where these go, and you stand a good chance of eventually destroying your camera. I was amazed at some footage of a Formula car crash shot with a GoPro - the car flipped about 5 times or so and the camera didn't miss a beat. I see that even shows like MythBusters use them. I'm only happy that they don't charge an arm and leg to buy these. A 32GB SD card might cost half of the camera's price.Battery life is great, the sound quality is decent (not the best by any means but what do you expect with a device that small?) and the image quality is fine for the price. I see noise artifacts and degradation in image quality because it compresses alot (the video is shot in MP4) but I just can't be unhappy with GoPro because it delivers where and when we need.An important thing to know is that the GoPro wasn't designed as an underwater camera - even though it has a waterproof housing - that is for things like surfing and other water sports. I was dismayed myself upon seeing blurry underwater photos when I first used it. The stock housing isn't designed to make this an underwater camera  - but a *waterproof* camera. The lens on the casing is convex in order for water drops to better move away for the camera's shooting. What's neat is that there's an underwater flat lens housing that keeps the image sharp both above and below water. Because the glass in front of the lens is flat, you'll probably get droplets sticking to it, but I read that using some Rain-X helps. I've tried to be fair while I'm obviously a GoPro fan, because it makes my job easier. Even with the compression issues I still rank this as a must-have in the image and filmmaking arsenal.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Nielsen
Reviews.Content: The GoPro Hero camera is a great little camera.  The video quality is great.  The sound can be limited when you use the water proof case.  That isn't a negative, just a reality since you are trying to get sound through a sealed housing.  I recently took the camera on a 100+ mile MT bike trip to Canyonlands NP on the White Rim Trail.  The camera has multiple settings for video quality.  I used the 960P setting in stead of the 1080p because you get a little wider angle view with the 960 setting.  The video quality is amazing with this camera.  I mounted the camera on my helmut.  Even though the trail is rough the video is fairly smooth.  One negative is the helmut mount clip.  When mounting the camera to the helmut clip I found some excessive clearance between the mating parts.  I just used some duct tape to take up the gap.  With out fixing the gap issue the camera wiggled enough that it caused some video "bounce".  The issue was easily fixed with engineered duct tape.  The other mounts seem to be tight, maybe it was just a bad part.  I ended up buying the LCD back for the camera so I could see what I was recording before taking alot of bad shots.  The LCD back is really a must for the camera when you are out away from your computer for a few days, otherwise you can't look at the shots.  It would be a great product improvement to incorporate a LCD back in to the camera.  If you are considering buying the camera look closely at the package to verify what you are getting: selection of mounts etc.  I did't get the helmut mount in the package I bought so I had to buy it seperatly.  I also would recommend buying the 32Gb SD card, perhaps 2 so you have lots of storage media if you take lots of video.  Also, get a spare battery for long trips.  I would also get a charger that fits into a power adapter in a car.TN 5/17/2011

Reviews.Title: great for tooling around
Reviews.Author: Curdio
Reviews.Content: i love this camera, have been wanting one since every sporting event (especially racing) has these perspective view cameras.  researching the gopro.com website and seeing sample videos just made me want one even more.  the plastic lens on the plastic housing scratches pretty easy but doesn't horribly affect the image.  sound while in the plastic waterproof housing is poor but with the non-waterproof housing, sound quality is really good.  I use mine mainly for mountain biking but have also used for underwater filming/pictures of my kid.  i chose to get this instead of one of those waterproof digital cameras.  not having a viewfinder kinda sucks but since the lens is pretty wide angle you can approximate and get a good shot

Reviews.Title: COMPACT HD CAMERA- SURPISE CAMERA ANGLES
Reviews.Author: Ted Dixon
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Go Pro Hero camera kit so I can take high quality videos of water sports- primarily Kayak fishing. The Go Pro is very small and compact- and the accessory kit has lots of mounts so that you can secure the camera.The only problem with the camera- there is no way to see what you are shooting until after you download it.I mounted my camera directly on the deck of my Cobra Kayak Pro Fisherman which created an interesting camera angle, BUT with too much of the bow of the boat in the shot. It is really disappointing to take home 3 hours of raw video from a bad camera angle. I posted an edited version of my first video and EVEN my mother told me it was boring.The head strap that came with the kit- was missing a stainless steel machine screw and nut to secure it to the camera mount- I emailed the vendor but got no resolution.Overview: The camera is small, compact and easy to use- the video is FANTASTIC quality- High Def.BUT  having no way to review in field your video is a real draw back.The mount kit was incomplete-[...].[...].[...].GoPro Surf HERO Wide Camera

Reviews.Title: AWESOME DEVICE!
Reviews.Author: Chris Bridgeman
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely obsessed with this camera now......I'm a surfer from california and the video quality is amazing. Full 1080 HD is as high quality as your tv broadcasts. 720p is standard HD....Think how good this is! Its super easy to use (if u read the manual) and unbelievably durable. The 60 frames per second (fps) option is awesome for slow motion videos. I even took this the the driving range and watched my golf swing in slow motion with this. Its extremely helpful for golf so you can work on fine tuning your swing.The only thing that I'm worried about is losing this camera. No matter what mount you put on it, it will still sink. even with no mount, it sinks. I can't come up with a way to make it float so If it falls off in big surf I hope the leash will buy you enough time to grab it before its done for.The pictures on amazon are also pretty decieving. The camera isnt white at all. Its aluminum or something thats silver.The camera also has an unbelievably cool fish eye effect. If youre skeptical about it (i was), trust me, the fish eye looks really cool. One last thing, there was a guy who said it only takes 2gb sd cards...thats crap....I have a kinston 4gb class 4 and it works great.The only con i have with this camera is that the pictures are usually blurry....I want GoPro to come out with a firmware update that increases the shutter speed. Other than that, I am 100% satisfied. This is a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great, but not perfect.
Reviews.Author: David Grimm
Reviews.Content: Just got the camera last week and have managed to play with it in the pool.  Once you get it set, its pretty darn simple to use.  I'm very pleased with the video quality in the air.  In water, the focusing seems a little soft.  This is the sort of camera you turn on and leave on, so the ability to edit video is very important.  The pluses of this system are the mounts are very good, the video captured in daylight has been very good, and the ability to get replacement lens, housings, and additional mounts is also great.  Also, the system is cheap enough that you can take some risks with the camera and get some really fresh shots.The largest minus this camera has is its lack of documentation.  You would think a company that markets video equipment would have some videos on how to use their product, but they do not.  No videos and the instructions are written on a massive sheet of paper that would be difficult to use in a breeze.  Fortunately some users have created "how to" videos and you can see their stuff on Youtube.This is my first couple of days video, I'll post an update in a while.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera is great.  It is waterproof, has a ton of features, and can be mounted just about anywhere.Pros: 1. Bombproof  2. Great video  3. Battery lasts a long time  4. Tons of cool features (self time, interval pictures, multiple video modes)Cons: 1. Directions say you can't mount it upside down and capture video, but the firmware update still isn't out  2. Tried to talk to customer support about firmware multiple times...no answer  3. Lens is a little too wide.  It distorts a lot.  I prefer the Vholdr lens.I can't fault the camera too much because it takes great video and stills when there is plenty of light, and it's way tougher than the Vholdr.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't buy again
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with the intent of using it for mountain biking, wakeboarding, and a car race.  It worked pretty well for mountain biking.  Video quality is decent.  No videos I've taking in 1080p are ANYWHERE close to what the commercials show.  Maybe there are settings I'm unaware of?  Just don't expect fully featured 1080p camcorder type quality, it's definitely usable.  The sound is pretty awful.  My camera vibrated terribly inside the plastic case.  After I stuffed paper towels inside to cushion it, the vibration noise went away and made the sound merely bad, as opposed to Mute awful.Now to the downside.  I mounted this in a car during a race.  Worked really well day 1.  Unfortunately every single video from day 2 is unwatchable.  Somehow the files got corrupted.  There was no indication of a problem race day.  The file sizes look normal.  I have no idea how it happened, but losing 6+ hours of race day video is completely unacceptable.  After doing some research this seems to be somewhat common.  Typically it appears to happen when there is some kind of impact(which is understandable) but in my case there was no such impact.  Had I know this was an issue before hand, I would have gone with the ContourHD.As far as mounting, the 3M sticky mounts are unbelievably strong.  I was really impressed.  I don't like how there is no easy to way to mount the camera without the case.  I wish it had a place to screw in the typical camera mounts.Overall decent camera, but losing video due to corruption has completely soured me.  Maybe I'm just unlucky?

Reviews.Title: Go Pro Hero - Get It
Reviews.Author: Horse-N-Round
Reviews.Content: I got this on Amazon about a month back and have tested it on my motorcycle using the included water proof case and the included suction mount. Without really mastering the menus, I was ready to test it out. I was able to record some very nice quality videos in HD of course and was very pleased with the results. The package is top quality as are the included accessories and instructions and my purchase from Amazon was hassle free and got here a few days after I placed my order. The camera seems to be quite rugged and is amazingly small and lightweight. With the files it creates you can play right away on your PC without any conversion hassle or extra software, so that part is super.  Don't really have much complaints or that is below expectations - just that its made in China.  Its about as simple to use as a Kodak Instamatic but about a jillion times better.As far as "nice to haves" would be a viewfinder - it does not have one. That would no doubt add cost, increase space and eat more battery power though, so its a small trade off. You'll need to experiment with the best orientation from trail and error - record some, not the positioning, pop the card out, view it on your pc, then adjust if you need. The lens is very good and the mounts held up very well on my 4 cyl Kawasaki which can vibrate some at certain rpms. There are ways to have a remote monitor (and power) connected but I have not tested. It has a lot of features I have not yet used and I have not played much with low light or the other included case. Daylight performance was very good. The battery as shipped came charged so you can play right away. After a few trials, I did a full charge then filled my 4GB card up shooting 4 or 5 vids. It's better to take many smaller clips, then put together rather than one big long run and operating the controls on my motorcycle, wearing a full face helmet and heavy leather gloves was not that easy but not impossible.  It was a bit hard to tell when it was on or off since you need to look at the front of the camera and that's hard and dangerous on a moving bike.  A little practice memorizing the sequence and button pushing should do the trick.  It does have an indicator and sound beeps, both of  which can be customized. I could not hear the beeps with my helmet and earplugs on.You can see some of my test vids on You Tube - look up user account Robert8455. Note I have a couple vids using different cameras, so look for the HERO version called Good Times Rolling 001.I highly recommend this HERO to anyone looking for a top of the line, yet inexpensive High def, super rugged camera.  I ordered a 32GB SD card but have not tested it with that yet.

Reviews.Title: Great, BUT
Reviews.Author: Jager
Reviews.Content: I used the GoPro 4 days, then it just fell off my helmet on the chairlift at Mt. Hood Meadows on a great powder day. That sucked, 2' of powder to dig in. It needs to have a safety lace because the sticky pads do not hold. For $$ they get, GoPro should have a warning to use a lanyard to prevent lost, and the lanyard should be in the kit.The picture I got where great, still, no shake or out of focus shots. Video was clear at speed down black runs, very nice quality. They need to fix the glue problem and add a lanyard to all models.[...]

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Kaatherine L. Warren
Reviews.Content: I'm an off-roader that likes to capture stills and video on the trail. I have tried all sorts of cameras and attachments to make interesting video's, but there was always something lacking in the sound and image quality........until now! This little camera is perfect for off-road use. It's dustproof, waterproof, appears to be shockproof and takes great video with sound. At first it seems pricy but if you try to put something together close to this in quality and funcuality it would cost a lot more. They are coming out with alot of add-ons so you can upgrade if needed. I find it very easy to use. Being an off-roader I found a mount that works well with the Gopro's, It's a billet gopro mount that is sold on the internet. I think this camera is great just taking with you to get family video's or what ever sport your into.

Reviews.Title: Almost Indestructible, (Almost)
Reviews.Author: Garrett Hinote
Reviews.Content: GoPro HD Hero Naked Complete Review:Yes, a GoPro has survived a fall from low orbit. Yes a GoPro has been lost in the ocean for months and been recovered intact with complete recorded footage. Despite these success stories, (or maybe because of them), many people end up breaking their GoPros. These cameras don't just shrug off blows. Sure, they'll take serious punishment, but like anything, treat them with care and you'll be rewarded, neglect them, and they'll break.Speaking of break, let's break down the GoPro HD Hero Naked in this complete review:Tips: Some important things I've learned as a GoPro filmer-Stick with the basics. The HD Hero Naked is cheap, very similar to the newer HD Hero 3's and less risk monetarily for just as much fun.-Don't expect cinema quality your first go-around. The HD Hero records in a funky fisheye lens aspect. It is very recognizable but lacks the well-known cinemaesque feel to it.-Separate purchases are HIGHLY recommended. It's called Naked for a reason. Accessories related to the type of filming planned are recommended. Suction cup mounts for surfing, sticky mounts for mountain biking, pole mounts for skiing/snowboarding, etc.Pros/Cons:Pros:-Like the brand says, 'World's Most Versatile Camera".-Battery life is superb if rationed correctly. 7 hours can be expected at times from a single charge.-Takes standard SD. Much more convient to the camera that take micro-SD or some other obscure data storage medium-Different settings for different recordings. 1080p 30fps for regular shots, 720p 60fps for high speed shots, etc.Cons:-Low-Tech Interface. Frustrating menu navigation, buttons are a pain to push with the housing on.-No zoom. Like, at all...- Not very streamlined. It seems to take up the maximum amount of space for the given volume it possesses.-Sound. Not much of an issue, but the quality is borderline horrendous. (Just put music over it)Overall, this camera will allow you to capture the things you always deemed to risky to record on a regular camera. The "cool guy" is always the guy with GoPro footage to share. Its humbly priced compared to it's bigger brothers, but is still quite a hefty buy in it's own rights. If you wallet can afford it, buy one of these up to start recording your life in HD.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bernard Dubuc "Ben"
Reviews.Content: Picture is great, unbeatable for the price, I bought the video screen with it and it is helpful to line up the unit before recording, the little clips used to support it are fragile, be aware that squizing should be done symmetrically or else they break. I have recorder 235GB of data riding my motorcyle from Quebec city to Los Angeles, to do this I had to punch a hole in the casing to supply the camera with power, I used a 32GB sd card, the device produces files a little over 3GB but you can stiche the files seamlessly using a laptop. so on my longest day I recorded 28 GB and that was for a 8+hr of riding. I will do it again in the spring upon my return home but this time the camera will be affixed to my helmet. Worth every penny

Reviews.Title: no go pro
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: Hope you are a tec genius because you will need your skills.  This camera looks great  and creates a beautiful image when it works, IT fills a needed niche in the market but is terribly unreliable. I have tried and tried to get it to function correctly. the firmware upgrades seem to do little to address the crashing and general unreliability requiring one to often pull the battery and restart the camera  all too often. It freezes and does not respond to buttons. The camera is very particular about it's sd card but the company fails to recommend any particular type nor do they return requests for information on there support page. this is the second gopro camera i have tried, the first i returned for a replacement. I will be returning this one also. Too bad i missed some amazing footage due to malfunction. i would wait a while  to buy this camera till they figure this out and iron out the numerous problems.

Reviews.Title: GoPro is great!
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd GoPro camera.Use it all the time.  Only negative is the battery life is very low.

Reviews.Title: Hero is a Zero
Reviews.Author: Dflynn
Reviews.Content: Got a Hero 2 for Christmas and it just kept freezing up on me.  I used a high quality SD card that I use in my SLR camera so that should not have been an issue.  Upon further investigation, I learned that there were A LOT of people having this same issue.  The GoPro support website had crashed Christmas morning probably due to high traffic.  I tried to upload previous firmware versions and this did nothing to help the problem.  I really wanted to like this camera but in the end, I simply could not get it to work after about 3 hours of trying various things.  I consider myself highly tech savvy and I finally gave up.  If you're going to get one of these, I suggest you do your research and if you still decide on getting one, buy from a place with a good return policy.  Another item I felt was lacking was the LCD screen for setup and such.  Looks like something from the 80s but I understand this is more about the video it can produce and not so much about things like this.

Reviews.Title: ITs GREAT
Reviews.Author: jem
Reviews.Content: I did buy it from bestbuy for a little more. There was only one problem. I bought the motorsports mount but it came with a little stock mount and the little thing broke. So i emaild gopro and they sent me one out pretty quick other than that it is great. I have put my camera in the water and it didnt leak at all there is 5 different resoulutions. It's an awesome camera and i defenitly recommend this for any sport.it does come with the skeleton and one mount.GoPro HD Hero Naked

Reviews.Title: GO PRO helmet HD- BABY PROOF TOO
Reviews.Author: garden geek
Reviews.Content: We are adventure type people and when we were expecting our first baby- we knew we wanted a video camera. A tight budget prompted us to look at versatile video cameras to fit our outdoor fun (canoeing, kayaking, hiking, rock climbing) but also video a baby.While it does not have a zoom (duh! I knew this before I bought it) making it hard to take "stealth" pics of my baby BUT the videos I do get of her are sooooo cute since I have to put the camera right next to her. She plays with it like a toy for a bit and then loses interest and plays "normal" so I get some cute natural footage too.When she is investigating the camera- I am ever so thankful I bought the GOPRO- she has chewed on it, slobbered on it, dropped it.. all in the name of cute.It is the BEST baby proof cameraWe DO use it outside too and love what we get- mostly still shots, some video. Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Pandawake
Reviews.Content: I love the GoPro, I've had 2 of them and I love it! I think it should be able to film better during the night or in places where there's no much light. But still, with the GoPro you will be able to get very very good footage of your sports.

Reviews.Title: **NOT for under water**
Reviews.Author: timber
Reviews.Content: I just bought the whole setup for a scuba diving trip.  I took amazing shots only to find out when I got home that the camera cant really focus under water due to its bubble shaped housing.  So all my shots are out of focus (for an autofocus camera) and Im pretty bummed.  I wrote to the company and they said they are working out a housing fix to correct but do not have it on the market yet.  They advised to google and find some other after market company that sells the fix for THEIR camera.  Needless to say Im hugely disappointed.  Im sure the camera is as great as its made out to be for anything thats NOT under water.  Divers - really think about this - there are lots of camera out there - but I will say the convenience of wearing it on your head is pretty sweet. (Also notice of all the videos on the gopro website - they dont have underwater.)Besides the above, there are other shortcomings - inside housing fogs up in tropical areas - you can buy moisture absorbers for this though. I have not seen an option to tell how much memory is left in the card until its full.Good luck folks! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Great toy
Reviews.Author: Eisbaer
Reviews.Content: This camera keeps all its promises. Love it. The only criticism is that they should have better product descriptions for some of their related products. For example there is a mounting clip that comes with it and I have no idea what it is for or how to use it (the white little clippy thing which I think is called "easy release clip)). There is no description with the product or online what it is for.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: n
Reviews.Content: The video quality is amazing, and the water proof is great, but is not under warranty. The sound isnt great and the sound from the case shaking is bad, so adding music is great and using it hands free so on mounts or smooth hands. The pictures can be shakey but the video is exceptional. Downside is that you need one of the extra video lcd add or wait until you connect it to a tv or computer to see the footage, and there is no zoom, so you need to get a feel for it. But ive taken really good videos with this camera, and ive seen it on high quality video tv shows. I would recommend this camera for ouside sport use, to capture everything.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Quality for such a small package
Reviews.Author: Rick Sales "ricktech"
Reviews.Content: I took this little camera to a trip to New Hampshire mounted in the lower air dam of the bumper of my car and the quality is AMAZING.  I would highly recommend this camera.  I purchased the Go Pro 960 from Costco for 179.00.  I wasn't impressed with the quality and returned it for a full refund.  After waiting a few days for the order to arrive I realized that I had made a good choice.  The camera adjusts well to different light conditions.  The camera for some reason does incredibly well absorbing the vibrations from the vehicle.  I tried it under water and it is also amazing.  If you are considering a camera to record your sporting activities "Just do it" get this one.  The colors are very vibrant.  I also purchased the LCD back monitor.

Reviews.Title: definitely worth the money
Reviews.Author: rayt95
Reviews.Content: I got this for $270ish and it's the best camera for the money ever. I rigged up a pvc pipe pole mount. I put a sticky mount on my sea-doo going 60+mph. It looks awesome. Later I'll use the bar mount and go on some mtb rides. The sound quality is decent just use the rubber "thingy". The only downside is that sdhc cards are too expensive for plastic but that's not gopro's fault. Overall solid product and good luck breaking it.p.s.I wish they had an optional bright colored case that floated in the event it fell in the water

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Douglas
Reviews.Content: I knew the Go pro since some friends already have them. This is a very nice camera even to film kids playing with bycicles or swiming. The full HD is impressive.I strongly recommend.Douglas

Reviews.Title: i don't understand the poor reviews!
Reviews.Author: Shane M. Maberry
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of these cameras as does a friend of mine. The only problem I have ever had has been due to me forgetting my memory card. The camera does a great job on both stills and video. I will say that when recording if the mode button is clicked at the end of recording instead of the shutter button, then the file will trash automatically. I would guess that is what lead other reviewers to think they had junk cameras. This is also the case for the non-hd gopro.

Reviews.Title: Good For Specific Purpose
Reviews.Author: trekker gal
Reviews.Content: Ordered this as a "C"angle camera for a trekking shoot in Nepal. It's small but sturdy.You will definitely need to read the instructions to learn the ins and outs. You wont be able to pull it out the box and begin using it. It's fairly easy to use once you learn your way around the menu.Good stuff:  good quality image. wide angle option. above average audio quality when not using a case. sturdy construction. With the accompanying cases, its waterproof.  This camera is perfect for any kind of action sport.keep this in mind:  The lens fogs up easily when used with the waterproof case and the camera will heat up and cause it to shut down.  You can purchase the  high dollar antifog" inserts or just put a piece of chamis or a small bandaid inside the case. All will absorb the moisture.You can also buy the skeleton case which has openings on the sides for cables. The camera won't fog in this case, but again, the camera is not waterproof.Make sure your finger does not cover the small  on the  camera. You will muffle out the audio if you do that.If you program it for wide angle, keep those fingers on the body of the camera behind the lens otherwise you fingers will be captured in the framing.CONS:footage can be shaky even if you are just standing still. Static shooting is not what this camera is for. If you are looking to use it for beautiful wide screen landscapes, forget it. It's best for action shots. Monopod or makeshift steady cams will reduce the shaky cam look a little.No external audio input. Only an on board audio mic. (The new HD HERO 2 has an input for an external mic)The on board mic is senstitive, so it will pick up every noise... breathing, heartbeats etc... (even in the case but muffled)In some conditions, the camera will heat up and shut down.If you use the LCD, plan on extra batteries. LCD is great, it will suck the life out of the camera.Go Pro has a variety of pkgs, but you might as well purchase the naked and the accessory kit that has everything-mounts, cases, extra screws and adapters.If you have the funds, I would recommend purchasing the following.Extra batteries!! You will lose a battery if you are shooting in rugged conditions.  Battery life is not 2.5 hours. it's more like and 1-1.5replacement lens kit-lens on the case gets easily scratchedHarness-all of them, chest and helmet. warning about the chest harness. unless you have the LCD to frame your shots, you might want to make sure you lock the camera in place with an up angle. You will end up with torso shots (or change your view to 960).UPDATE:  Go to this website-they have all the tips, tricks and Go PRo workarounds you need. [...]If audio is necessary in chest harness shots, keep in mind the camera will pick up the heartbeat and breathing of your photographer.monopod- this is fantastic to use.Get one with a ball mount so you can use the monopod as an extender arm.  Keep in mind the monopods do not have the correct mount for the go pro case. You will have to purchase the adapter from GO Pro for $8.  I did and it did not come with a bolt or nut. I went to Home Depot and got a set and it works great.LCD goes without saying.back up memory cards. class 4 and higher at least 16GB.external hard drive-dump your footage onto the ext hard drive. Once you lose it, it's lost forever. The files size is huge which is a good reason not to store it on your computer.BTW this codec works fine with mac. never have had problems importing.UPDATE:  If you are using FCP software, save yourself the headache of rendering every single time.  Dump the video files into compressor and convert to pro-ress. This will save you a ton of time and memory.I created a droplet so all I have to do is drag the file to the droplet. It processes in the background so you can do other things while its converting.

Reviews.Title: It didn't exactly fit my needs but I love it anyway
Reviews.Author: MoovyNut
Reviews.Content: I like the GoPro camera.  It's relatively simple to use, expandable by adding a battery pack or video screen, ruggedly protected in a waterproof case, and small and light enough to be mounted anywhere,  and shoots in HD.  When framing your shots, you need to be mindful of the fact that the lens makes objects appear to be farther away than they really are (much like the effect a "fisheye" lens has).  I did not take this into account when I bought it and I was caught off guard when I downloaded my first footage.  Plan on everything farther than 4 four feet away from the camera appearing to be much farther away than they really are.  I had wanted a camera that had a less distorted view, but I have found other applications for the GoPro.  BTW, this was more of a toy for me and not intended for profession use.  Still it is fun and easy to use and relatively inexpensive.  I'm thinking about buying a second camera so I can capture the action from two perspectives.  As for my original need, I am still looking for a small, inexpensive, self contained, digital HD camera that can be temporarily mounted in all sorts of places.  I recommend the GoPro as long as one is aware of it's limitations.  FUN FUN FUN

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Knight "Italianknight"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband. He loves to ride bikes and being outdoors. The first thing he did was put the camera in the water! The video is very sporty. The picture is great. It works for biking riding, walking, with the kids and in the water. This camera is awesome. The only problem I have is that now he wants all the accessories!

Reviews.Title: A helluva lot better than expected
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking HD videos for the money. GoPro's main pitch involves extreme sports, but that's not why I bought it. Anyone with more than a casual interest in digital photography should recognize this thing for being much more than a "rad" camera. Think about it....you get ultra-wide-angle (170 degrees) when set for taking 720p video. Yer looking at $1500 or more going the DSLR route. Granted, you get less flexibility.Not a DSLR substitute - just a d@mn good hold-you-over.....and a rad camera for the crazy stuff.

Reviews.Title: You won't be disappointed!
Reviews.Author: roosthuizen
Reviews.Content: I had the Standard GoPro Hero prior to getting the HD Hero, and the difference in quality is mind-blowing! I use this camera almost every other day, whether it be for surfing, longboarding, skateboarding, or snowboarding. I can take up to 20 vids on a 2GB card, and have gotten almost 50 on a 4GB card. The quality is immense, and the camera itself is ridiculously easy to use. A must-have for outdoor/extreme sports enthusiasts!

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality
Reviews.Author: Cesar E. Raffinnaar
Reviews.Content: I have to say I'm impressed by the quality of this tiny go pro camera. I'm using to record my videos when sailing. Sound is excelent when using the cover that has a hole . Battery is good for about 3 hrs. Great product.Thanks go pro !!!!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Francis Arellano "nitecrwlr"
Reviews.Content: I have had a Vholdr and this is a much more reliable setup.  -1 star for the complexity of using two buttons for all controls.  The quality can't be beat though.  THis is by far the most popular camera on the slopes.

Reviews.Title: GoPro HD Motorsports HERO
Reviews.Author: Vandy24
Reviews.Content: this camera rocks.  i've taken it on motorcycle rides, in a live-fire shoothouse, and let my wife capture flyball (dogs) races with it.  the camera performs beautifully, and the HD images are fantastic.  i mounted it to various parts of my motorcycle and done 100+ mph.  later, when i reviewed the video i was amazed at how clear the sound of the engine comes across in the video (and not a bunch of wind).  also, i mounted it to my helmet (with the included attachments) when i went through a shoothouse, and captured live fire training.  the camera isn't at all affected by the concussion of the handgun or rifle (it is advertised as "bomb-proof").  one day i'll find a reason to test it's waterproof-ness.my only complaint is that on two separate occasions the video seems to have frozen without my knowledge.  when i later went to edit the footage, the video simply stops playing.  although, the file remains large and the caption shows that the file is still playing.  could be a fluke or a memory card problem, i dunno.  outside of that i'm enjoying the camera and trying to find new uses for it as the seasons change.

Reviews.Title: My Husband loves his new GoProHD
Reviews.Author: L. Olson "triagain"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my husband for Christmas and he can't stop playing with it.  He has taken videos, skiing, biking, swimming.  Loves it!!  Wishes it had a remote and came with it's own video editing software.  He had to purchase QuickTime pro to edit the videos but they look awesome!  Takes some practice to get the right tilt on the camera but that's all part of the fun!  Look for videos on youtube from skifam1.  He loves his GoProHD!!!

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS
Reviews.Author: 100mw laser pointer
Reviews.Content: strait out of the box, the product was damaged internally, inside the sd card slot, there were pieces broken that blocked the card from getting in, this product feels cheap and is every bit of it. I didn't even get it to use it once and I already hate it. Very very disappointed with go pro.

Reviews.Title: Returned with no interest for replacement
Reviews.Author: R. V. Downing
Reviews.Content: This is a limited review as I didn't get much into using the product but make of it what you will.I bought this setup primarily to use for modest snowboarding. Upon opening the package, I was very excited. The waterproof casing, mounts, and devices all seemed exceptionally solid and well designed. The box included two sets of instructions: one for the camera operation (in multiple languages) and one for mounting tips. The mounting tips instructions were remarkably inadequate. I spent an hour trying to figure out what all the pieces were for and how to figure out the helmet strap (before realizing the strap only works for vented bicycle helmets).So after fumbling with it to figure out a mounting strategy for my snowboarding helmet, I attempted to use the camera a bit to set up the pointing. The camera simply would not recognize a few of my SD cards. I thought the cards might have been defective as I had bought them from an Amazon seller not too long ago but I loaded them into my Olympus and they worked just fine. So once I found an SD card the camera would actually recognize, I tried to do some initial filming and the camera just beeped. I spent another hour troubleshooting this using the inadequate camera operation instructions which no where seemed to talk of an issue with three beeps. Anyway, I finally decided to just give up and return it and requested a refund rather than a replacement.My overall impression was that the mounts and case equipment were awesome, but the glitchy camera hardly seems worth $300, even though I can't really speak to that since I couldn't get it to shoot anything. In the end I think I'd rather just get a Flip or other cheaper HD camera and Jerry-rig my own mounts and cases (or even just continue hand held shooting). If you're doing stuff like surfing I realize this will be tougher as you'll need a tight waterproof seal.

Reviews.Title: Great for sports but not home video
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "tothemoon"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera hoping to use it for sports and home video.  The video is absolutely beautiful.  I love the wide angle shots.  It's small and simple.  I was actually sad to return it.We returned it though because the sound, even w/o the waterproof covering, is not good.  Very tinny sounding.  You could hear what was being said but it was bad quality.  It also concerned me that the lens, because it's a wide angle, protrudes from the casing, making it easier to scratch or fingerprint.These may not be concerns for all customers but just an fyi.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: vanjenzo
Reviews.Content: Best Camera for off roading, skiing, roller coasters and biking, anything!!!  Perfect gift for just about anyone!! I definitely recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it
Reviews.Author: Wendi Vines "psalms23rd"
Reviews.Content: I've used several other types of recorders and have been most satisfied with this one. I love the wide angel view which allows capture of so much more action. I love the impact and waterproof case which allows for recording in so many different types of environments. The methods of wearing the device are secure. Use is simple. The photographs wonderful. The software for trimming the video is easy to use. The accessories are vast. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Hilerie R. Gellenbeck
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I had to return because of issues with the SD card but I think if I had time to research I could have fixed the issue.  Great return policy!

Reviews.Title: Scratch
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this to friend because it came with tiny little scratches on the lens and when you record there are blurs on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Terrible product
Reviews.Author: dig48109
Reviews.Content: Unit kept failing. Didn't hold a charge and overall. Would freeze. Removed battery. Upgraded firmware to no avail. Sent unit back.Buyer beware. Go Pro makes great ads and promo videos, but their quality is poor.

Reviews.Title: Like having an insurance adjuster on board
Reviews.Author: jeff r jones
Reviews.Content: I've mounted the 2 Go Pro Naked's that I bought in both our vehicles because I wanted to have peace of mind when I or my wife is driving. With the 'any thing goes' driving these days, it's nice to know we'll have a recording, in case one of us got into an accident and not have to worry about finding witnesses to back up our report.

Reviews.Title: Hero HD review-updated
Reviews.Author: S. Grant
Reviews.Content: This is a love-hate relationship with this camera.  I love this camera.  It takes great HD video, but is a pain to update the software.  I purchased the wifi remote with low expectations other than just the off/on/record  feature.  I updated the firmware- 2 days effort.  I downloaded cineform- several hours.  Finally got that done.  Updated the camera, the wifi and the remote-several more attempts and several more hours.  FInally got that done and tested the camera and remote.  Worked like a champ.  I charged up all three and at my next race weekend, I put them in the car.  Nothing worked.  It's like it "forgot" its programing.I hate this camera.  So I am going to yank the wifi off this camera and put it back naked- at least it worked before I installed the wifi remote!3/27/13 Update- Well I have to eat some crow now.  I contacted GoPro via their website and they responded within 48 hours with great support.  I did not know that the original GoPro Hero must have its firmware updated manually to make the wifi remote work.  So I followed their instructions and got that done on the first try.  Then updated the wifi backpack and remote (through Cineform) and everything worked.  I have tried it repeatedly for several days now and it works perfectly.  There is a delay in turning on the camera with the remote that was longer than I expected, but it turns on the camera,  then it shows "1 camera" then "ready".  Then you hit the record button and the red lights start flashing and recording begins.  Also works well to stop recording and turn the camera off.  I am now rating it at 4 stars- up from 2.

Reviews.Title: Great for adventure!
Reviews.Author: Danielle Alamares
Reviews.Content: Go Pro is really protable and you can use it for swimming, wakeboarding or even zipline. Any sports activities. Just add-on a head/chest gear and you're good to go! Though I'm just not a fan of the buttons because it's hard to push with the case but overall it's perfect for adventure!

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after a year
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I bought this back in november 2011. It worked well and I used it a few times (under 10) and had no issues. I just came back from vacation where I went zip lining and it was probably the first time I actually had something good to record. Recorded 2 videos and everything was going great. On the third video, I noticed that the red recording light wasn't blinking and it was stuck on. None of the buttons were responding so I had to yank the battery out. The camera would not turn on after I put the battery back in. The battery was fully charged and I only recorded 15 minutes tops before it froze and would not turn on. Came home frustrated that I missed out on the whole day's worth of activities, I plugged the camera into the charger. The red light came on and it was charging like normal. Once the light turned off, I tried to turn the camera on but again, would not turn on.This is extremely disappointing that the camera suddenly stopped working out of thin air. I'm still playing with it, trying to turn it on but it's not working. I was using the unit with the waterproof housing, so I am certain it's not water damage. I started researching and saw a lot of problems similar to mine. This is a great camera when it works, but I don't think I'll buy another one knowing that it might just decide to stop working one day. I am sure I'm out of warranty since it was purchased over a year ago and it'll probably cost as much as a new one to get it fixed. Great product when it works but very unreliable...beware.

Reviews.Title: GoPro not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Martha M. Reeves
Reviews.Content: Do not purchase one of these! We never got to use it! It doesn't stay turned on and we can not do anything with it, they said we could have 20 % discount on a newer model!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what we were looking for!
Reviews.Author: Solasxanam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are pretty active.. For Christmas I was looking for a mountable video camera so he can snowboard, airsoft and whatever else he wants with it-- super happy that I spent my money on a GoPro!

Reviews.Title: GoPro Camera a big success
Reviews.Author: Barbara Sears
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my 15 year old granddaughter.  It was a huge hit and she tried it out with a harness as she snowboarded the day after Christmas.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Bradley
Reviews.Content: Nice for photos and movies (fair in low light, but nice otherwise).  It is used as a second camera for transmitting live video on a drone aircraft.

Reviews.Title: Great product for its price and Amazon's delivery was even better!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am an avid scuba diver... on my way to completing my advanced certification... I love photography and want to try my skills underwater.. However, the housing for my DSLR costs around $ 3K so I opted for the GoPro HD (not the latest one) mainly because of the following:1. Price (the latest model is more than double the price of this one)2. I wanted to know if this camera will actually deliver underwater as per the expectations, before I invest a lot of money into it3. I figured that if I have full HD video (1080p at 30fps) then I can pretty much take frame freeze captures and turn them into still photos...so I compromised on the still photo resolution (which is 5MP for this camera)I must say that I am pretty impressed with the product. The following are the reasons:Pros:1. Extremely small form factor makes it easy to be mounted or carried in extreme sports (in my case deep diving)2. Camera itself is rubberized so that little accidental exposure to water does not break it3. Comes with a housing that is water proof up to 180' (which satisfies most deep diving needs)4. Has a very wide angle which is critical for underwater diving (one of the reasons for a 5 star)5. Captures slow motion video using 60fpsCons:1. Settings and menu takes some time to get used to as its a small screen and choice based system (but I can understand why it is this way, as incorporating a big display would have made it more bulky and would have increased the price)2. Could have included a batter charger (currently only has the USB cable which you use to charge as well as transfer photos videos to your laptop)Overall I recommend this camera for almost any outdoor sport... just remember that in low light conditions such as underwater, no matter what the camera, you will need a separate artificial light source for your pictures to come out good. This is true for any camera you use and should not be considered as a con for this awesome device!

Reviews.Title: Battery life could be better
Reviews.Author: E. Raslich
Reviews.Content: GoPros are fun. And this one is probably really cheap now that it's two generations behind. Pick it up if it fits your needs, otherwise grab the Hero 3 White edition (the cheapest one) and get more bang for your buck. Hopefully they improved the battery life. It barely lasts 2 hours, which I think is ridiculous given that it's supposed to be for adventures and I'm not normally near a charge station when I'm adventuring.

Reviews.Title: GoPro HD Surf Hero
Reviews.Author: Robhood
Reviews.Content: well when I bought that little one I was really happy with it, but 2 months after the Hero2 shows up and now they have the Hero 3 :)but regarding what you want to do this one give me already all that I want and I have a lot of fun with it water (surfing, scuba diving), never let me down so far. Great product.

Reviews.Title: go pro hero
Reviews.Author: J. Keating "ace higelhofer"
Reviews.Content: I felt the directions, while lengthy, did not really give me the direction I needed to know what the individual mounting parts were for.That was left to "trial and error".  Also, I don't feel that the camera is easy to use.  Other than those comments, the camera worked as advertisedand I was able to mount it to my helmet where it stayed firmly attached.  The wide angle lense takes some getting used to but overall, I amsatisfied with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great-- the accessory mount we bought is a zero
Reviews.Author: J. M. "Book Diva"
Reviews.Content: The camera is great!  My hubby is a avid cyclist averaging 150 miles a week over 2-3 rides. He had been talking about getting one of these and I bought it for his birthday so he could use it for a big ride "The Breathless Agony" (crazy).  I any case, he loved it, but hated the helmet mount system -- went out and bought a mount for his handlebars and literally on the first ride-- it started bouncing and rattling and broke off-- caroming off the highway.  Fortunately this didn't cause any wipeouts (on a downhill section) and the housing miraculously stayed intact (40 mph).  The case got a big gouge right over the lens, but the camera itself is perfectly fine!The camera takes great shots and video.  I will say that the next model is worth the upgrade-- my husband said that it was difficult to know when it was on for sure because the power button and controls are all on front of it and there isn't any way to know if it is really on.All in all, knowing what I know now I would have bought the next version.The mounting we bought was from the GoPro manufacturer.  They need to make it out of metal, not cheap plastic!

Reviews.Title: 200 mph and LOVE  it!
Reviews.Author: KManz
Reviews.Content: Awesome resolution and stability (can't believe we didn't have this 100-passes ago). Great gadget for adrenaline-junkies.Comments (not necessarily complaints):1) "Adequate" instructions are potentially (likely?) IN-adequate for some;2) Brace yourself to drop another $50 for roll bar and handlebar mounts;2) Disappointed that GoPro says they've no plans for a metal mount (NHRA prohibits plastic mounts); apparently GP recommends combining their tri-pod mount with a metal mount from someone else;3) In noise and bright sun it's hard to tell if recording w/o putting your face smack in front of the cam.

Reviews.Title: GoPro HD Motorsports Hero
Reviews.Author: Donald E. Banka
Reviews.Content: I have two of these camera's they are great a little hard to get used to the menu's.  Both of my camera's have worked without a problem.  Be sure to check out GoPro web site and YouTube for helpful video's on setup and uses.  Buy the anti fog inserts you will need them.

Reviews.Title: Great action camera, not so great plastic mounts sometimes
Reviews.Author: Merc
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good words about this camera!  I've used it on my race car and many other race cars.  The only problem I've had is the plastic arms sometimes break after a hard hit on the race track but GoPro has replaced them under warranty.  I would recommend these cameras to anyone and the HERO2 is supposed to be even better!

Reviews.Title: Enjoy the camera
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Pokora
Reviews.Content: So far, I've used this go-pro for vehicle videos driving cross country, getting great shots of scenery mounted on top of my car.  Also, mounted it on my ski-helmet for my last trip to Park City.  This camera is the standard for fun video (and still shots).  I'll be using it on my trail-run this weekend too.buying a 16 gig SD card is a must though.  battery life is between 2-4 hours.

Reviews.Title: GOPRO Hero
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Pretty neat camera/video. Used on motorcycle, does not bounce or move even thought camera may shake at times due to road condition.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera... but a little more gets you...
Reviews.Author: Tommi Wetherald "TomW"
Reviews.Content: I got the Go Pro HD Hero for Christmas. I haven't had a chance to go boarding or kayaking with it yet, but I got a few uses out of it so far. I have some bike ride, dog walking and some rabbit video that I need to edit to edit some nice videos out of.The outdoor video is amazing. This camera is worth its price for so many reasons. Ive paid almost this much for an underwater housing before.Wide angle view is awesome. You can get the whole action. Camera rotations don't make people as dizzy. A wide angle lens for a camera can cost you way more than this whole device.There are numerous mounting options depending on what you want to do with it. My favorite mounting so far is the tripod mount attached to a mono-pod. (This gives you the ability to record high or low angles easily. Basically a pole-cam)Cons:So far It seems to do a great job in the daylight. Get near dusk or indoors in normal room lighting the video does not look so good. I tried to record a motor swap tutorial for the AR.Drone with my hero sitting in my living room with the lights on, and the end result is basically a barely visible dark mess. This might be the biggest reason for me to get the HD Hero 2.Differences:Based on my research it seems the following are the main differences (This first set are the ones that matter to me). I ordered the Hero2 for personal comparison.-Low light capability. HD Hero is basically for outdoors use during the day (also white balance seems to be improved.-Independent resolution and viewing angle. HD Hero has fixed resolution and angle combinations-Wifi BacPac streaming. February 2012 will bring a streaming BacPac that will let you stream video and control the camera from comp or smart phone.-10 (11mp) pictures in one second burst. (Great for making sure you get that action still.)Other differences that aren't worth the upgrade to me:-11mp sensor. (OK so this sensor is probably responsible for the low light ability, but the pixel count doesn't matter that much when you're using it for video.)-Easier to read front display. There are list of modes in the back, and you can learn to read the codes. (ie. UPd means upside down)Summary:So basically if you want something to record awesome outdoor video for a good price the HD Hero is the way to go. I don't think anyone will be dissatisfied with the camera for this use. If you want any of the extra features or better video quality, it seems its best to pay a little more to get the HD Hero 2.Look on YouTube for comparison videos, and there are several good examples.

Reviews.Title: Handy and fun
Reviews.Author: S_ditty
Reviews.Content: So far the GoPro has been easy enough to capture video on, the still pictures are not very good, but considering the resolution it'll work. The big problem with GoPro in general is that it's not easy to play back in it's original format on normal computers. I tried the TV out feature, and although it recognizes the tv jack is plugged in, I can't get any output. I have managed to convert the AVI output to MPEG and MP4 format and that plays back smoothly with the MPEG looking great on my laptop.The big decision comes next with a purchase of video editing software to convert and cut down the huge amounts of raw footage I have in just a few times of use. Disappointing in the fact that even a conversion program either costs money or is full of spam and pop-ups.Overall the GoPro is a great tool with the downside being no included editing/conversion software

Reviews.Title: Incredibly handy with great attachments.
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific piece of kit. GoPro camera is good although does not take nearly as good videos as my Canon S95 digital camera. Indoors low light video perfornce is very poor, although it's not really intended for that anyway. Sometimes however after being Skiing and then going into the Ski lodge, you can hardly make out anyone once inside.It is really fantatastic for hands free video. I have videos when mounted on my Ski helmet and also mounted to the back of my Ski and I purchased a handlebar clamp and have used it attached to my ski pole. Very versatile. Still trying to decide which is the best resolution for skiing though, the 960p gives great wide andge but very rounded and distorted where the 1080p is better but you have to get the camera angle right otherwise you'll miss the scene.On the whole though, I'd definitely recommend this - especially the Helmet Pro as the attachments that come with it are excellent. Amazon do deals now and then so keep an eye on that. Mine was over $60 below list price.

Reviews.Title: Makes a great dash camera during the day - not so great at night
Reviews.Author: toolio
Reviews.Content: After several close-calls on the road, I bought this to use as a dash camera in my vehicle due to the over-abundance of bad drivers where I live.  The suction cup mount holds very well on my windshield and hasn't fallen off once in the past month.  Videos taken with the camera can be seen here: [...].  The only recommendation I have for improvement would be better capability for nighttime filming.  An IR illuminator would be a great accessory.

Reviews.Title: Great Video Camera
Reviews.Author: TT
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband for Christmas and some of the footage he captured was amazing. Even while riding dirt bikes the video came out smooth. Worth the price, now I have to continue to purchase the accessories.Great sportsmans toy!

Reviews.Title: Best camera so far for its use but bought it right before the new model
Reviews.Author: robert shopshear
Reviews.Content: So far I love the GoPro.  It has to be the best bang for the buck for filming HD movies and social activities.  My only gripe is I purchase the GoPro and they released the GoPro HD 2 a few weeks later.

Reviews.Title: Hero is a Hero
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Magee
Reviews.Content: After looking at the videos and reviews I decided to get this unit. I have seen that a few people have been disappointed in it but I blame that on either the user or a random defective part. So far this has exceeded my expectations. I got a 32gig card for it and when set to low quality(which is still good quality) I can get 2.3 hours of video from the camera. It writes 3gig files to the card, and then starts another one if it can. Or at least that is what it is writing at the lowest setting. I bought some extras for it since I knew I would be using this in my car as well as on my helmet. Good product.

Reviews.Title: Start Here
Reviews.Author: D. Rogers
Reviews.Content: I have tried several action cameras and as many people would do I tried to go the inexpensive route first.  I have owned 4 others and this one is by far the best.  All the other cameras worked with different levels of success.  Finally after missing many hours of great action video struggling with the other cameras, I broke down and bought a Go Pro.  It did take about 30 minutes to get it programmed, but once I did I got 16 hours/64 Gig of awesome HD video.  Now I have the camera I should have bought in the beginning and several hundred dollars worth of cameras collecting dust in the closet.  Don't make the same mistake I did, start with the best.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for your adventures
Reviews.Author: reefturkey
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Motorsports Hero so that I can record my track sessions at the race track. It's a great camera and delivers great video which is what I mainly bought it for. I really want to give it a perfect score but find that to be difficult. The audio quality is horrible. I can barely hear the engine on my car or anything else that is worth recording. Just wear a pair of those little spongy ear plugs and watch TV. Wht you hear is how the recording from this camera sounds like. I have to give credit where it's due the video quality is amazing for such a little device. There are various modes to choose from with the best being the full HD 1080P recording. Be warned that recording at this setting takes up a lot of space. A 20 minute track session can take 2+GB of space.I'm going to summarize the pros and cons below to help others decide if this is the right camera for them:Pros:1. Awesome wide angle video2. Great wide angle photos3. Multiple mounting options4. Plenty of accessories5. Very rugged6. Water proof7. 32 gb sd card capacity8. Great time laps photo mode. (This was a pleasant surprise)9. Great value for the moneyCons:1. Audio is not that great2. Menu is a bit hard to use the first few times3. No LCD view finder (can be purchased separately as an add-on)4. No external mic jack5. can't take pictures/video while the usb charger is plugged into the computer6. Underwater recording requires a replacement lens that is flat not convex (extra purchase)7. No remote control to turn the camera on/off or to snap random imagesConclusion:If you want an awesome camera to capture all of your adventures with great quality images and video then this is the camera for you. Its super easy to carry and rugged. Some may complain that there is no external viewfinder and that the audio quality is not hi-fi. They are able to deliver this awesome package by obviously skipping on some of these features while maintaining their aggressive price point. My main wish is that it had an external mic jack so that i could place the mic in the car away from the wind so that it can pick up good sound. The competition has this feature.

Reviews.Title: Don't trust the mounts
Reviews.Author: Casey Hyer
Reviews.Content: I was told by gopro that these mounts were bomer and they never come off. Lost my skiing along with HUNDREDS of other people this winter. I called the lost and found and they said that they have several people loose them every day at snowbird. don't tust this on your helmet.

Reviews.Title: GoPro HD Motorsports Hero camera
Reviews.Author: R. Edwards "Bargain Hunter"
Reviews.Content: Completed my first test ride with this camera mounted on my motorcycle.  Awesome full HD 1080p video.  It's amazing how everything in the shot is in focus, foreground, background, everything, all of the time.  Simple operation and very versatile, it can do it all:  video, stills, time lapse, 3 frame burst, self timer, waterproof to 180 ft.  It could use a remote control, but, hey, I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: HERO Takes You There
Reviews.Author: Scooter
Reviews.Content: This little guy is almost bulletproof. Mine is mounted on a Traxxas Rustler RC truck that goes really, really fast until it hits something. After several high-speed runs through gravel, dirt and on asphalt, I did manage to break one of the camera's mounts when the truck hit a hunk of concrete at about 60mph. Truck and camera survived, and I got a great shot of the actual impact ... just like on TV!The HERO is capable of decent images, but external shocks occasionally cause some brief pixellation distortion. Sound is good ... I can hear the truck's motor screaming clearly, even through the sealed camera case. It's also water-resistant, as demonstrated by its inverted submersion in a mud puddle after one of the truck wrecks.Setup and use of the camera is fairly easy, but some of the settings are difficult due to the tiny icons on the tiny LCD. I'd also like to find a flatter lens so there is less fisheye distortion. I guess my only real complaint is that the camera is surprizingly heavy for its size (still only a few grams, though). The truck can't pull wheelies as well when the camera is mounted in its nose, but other than that, it's a hoot!So, if you're looking for an unobtrusive little camera that can capture serious action and survive, the HERO is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Happy customer
Reviews.Author: Oyster
Reviews.Content: All in all I am happy with my purchase, so much that I have gone out and bought a lot of accessories for my GoPro Hero HD.Don't plan on buying this for your everyday camcorder needs. Thought the picture is really good it is made and best used for action shots. Sound isn't great but not too bad again think about what it was made for. The suction cup works a lot better than expected just keep it and the surface your putting on it clean and have peace of mind, it will hold. The camera has a lot of features and though not the friendliest to use (lots of options using only three digits to describe will take sometime to learn all of what they can and will do,) it does provide a good amount of flexibility.Would I buy again, Hell yes, I might buy a second one for 3D shots and multiple angels :-)

Reviews.Title: Case broke after a year
Reviews.Author: Binh Dang
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and setup, but the case decided to crack in half after a year of use. Superb video for its size.  Have taken to speeds of 150+ mounted behind a windscreen and it has held up.

Reviews.Title: GoPro Camera
Reviews.Author: J. McCann
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Works pretty well. Has some trouble with the sun or bright / dark areas. We took it inner tubing and took nearly 2000 pictures plus hours of videos in a week of fun. I can't seem to get the highest resolution video to play smoothly on anything I have PC wise. Hate to think I'll have to purchase a MAC just to see them correctly. In all, it's a fun new toy!

Reviews.Title: GoPro Motorsports HD for vacation - car ravel
Reviews.Author: E. Savage "NoWin"
Reviews.Content: I bought the HD Motorsports GoPro for travel and autocross video. I like the camera a lot, but if you're a bit shy on the tech end, the instructions will need to be reviewed a few times to get you going. They could make them a bit more "user-frinedly". The included suction mount is functional, but after seeing a few reviews on the RAM flexible mount, you'll want to invest in one of those after trying the GoPro mount for a few weeks, especially if you need to mount the camera at odd windshield angles. Trust me. The optional rear-video screen (LCD bacpac) makes changing settings a lot easier for the less tech savvy, but if you go and check out the tons of YouTube or blog reviews and "How-To's" BEFORE you need to use the camera, you'll be fine. I did a fair amount of looking a GoPro tips websites and that helped a lot.For shooting and editing, practice makes perfect, and I use a Mac so I'm well versed in manipulating the files on that OS. Can't say if its easier or harder for a Windows user. I do wish GoPro would make an application for both platforms that could render the files with minimal fuss....but hardware seems to be there strong point, so its not a big deal for me. I bought both the optional Battery backpac and LCD backpac. Pricey, but a good investment. I have an older unused and padded camera bag that will do very nicely for storing it when not in use.
