For full day drives, you may need to run a AC adapter to the unit, so you need to think of buying a skeleton case with the holes open on the side (just to let you know), or rig up a setup without a back cover but use some HD rubber bands to keep the unit secure in the front portion of the housing.Get a good SDHC card. I picked up a 32Gb card (Lexar pro, class 10, I think) and have no problems with it. Don't cheapen out and get a card that's 10 or 20 bucks less as its probably a minimal Class 4.I like the GoPro Hero HD. Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for family fun!
Reviews.Author: medxowner
Reviews.Content: I received the camera (Motorsports HERO) last week. I also ordered the grab bag of mounts. I put a "stick-on" mount on my helmet along with one on each of my kids helmets. We spent the next few hours riding dirt bikes, go-carts, and quads making videos. When I plugged the camera into my TV, I have to say I was amazed!!!! The video was unbelievable. I played around with the suction mount on my car and also was amazed at the video quality.Small issue I found:1: I filmed some video with the water-proof back on the case and some with the open back. With the water-proof back you can barely hear the bikes in the video. This is fine if you are going to edit them and add music. This back is listed for use >100mph but I tried it anyway on my kids dirtbikes because I thought dust would be a problem. The dust wasnt an issue and the sound quality was not good.I also noticed a rattle sound when using one of the stick-on mounts. This was solved by putting a piece of tape over the mount.With the "open" back however, I was amazed how good it sounded. The bikes sounded perfect.I am very happy with this camera and plan on making some awesome videos with my kids and their bikes.

Reviews.Title: Like the 1080p in daylight, but definitely requires good lighting
Reviews.Author: macfawlty "macfawlty"
Reviews.Content: This is a unique little camera and I like the idea. The 1080p video format is the biggest selling point. The image quality is quite nice in daylight. The colors look pretty good and fairly good saturation. The footage captured from a helmet cam is shakier than what you see on the web site. They must have smoothcam'd it in post to get it more steady (a disclaimer is probably necessary). In even the slightest low lighting situations and indoors, the video quality is VERY grainy and much darker than it appears in real life. That's a disappointment. Underwater the light has to be really good as well. I wasn't impressed with it underwater, but using it on a surfboard with splashing and dips under is still cool. The driving test I did came out pretty well. You have to be sensitive to how the camera is going to react to the lighting situation and compose your frame accordingly. Too much sky and everything else on the ground will be dark.CAVEAT: If you want your video smooth, you have to expect to smoothcam it in post with FinalCut or something.So, bottom line for me is that it's useful for biking, walking, driving, time lapse and all that, as long as it's in daylight. Having something that captures 1080p video on bike, car and such makes it a useful addition to my video work. All the other small cameras that capture video are at best 1080i, and interlaced looks awful with anything that moves.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Warner "Jake"
Reviews.Content: This thing is wonderful.  It shoots still pictures or video, it's super easy to use, and it comes with a variety of different bomb-proof housings to protect it.  We took it on vacation and our baby was throwing it around like babies do and we had it in the water filming fish while snorkeling.  I've attached it to my road bike while racing.  It can do anything, and the quality of the footage is great.I added the "LCD Backpack" so I can watch what I am filming and playback right on the camera, and I recommend that addition.This is a high quality, very small, lightweight, waterproof, and indestructible video camera that takes wonderful HD video.  I highly recommend it, not just for doing various extreme sports, but just in general to use as a video camera, especially when you are at all concerned about environments that might be wet or otherwise dangerous to an electronic device.One thing to note: due to the nature of the lens, the still photos are sort of "fish bowl" like - kind of rounded at the edges.  For video, some of the resolution settings are also fish bowl like but some are not.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: CJamazon
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing. If you are thinking about or even hesitating about buying this product, STOP, and buy it know! This product has exceeded my expectations and I wish I could go back in time with the gopro because i wish i had this sooner. I was hesitant at first about if it was going to be waterproof but to my surprise it has not ever been a problem. We attached it to our surf board an it has never fallen off or even budged. The clip just stuck right on the board and hasn't moved since. We have put in on surf boards, boogie boards, skim boards, we have gone jet skiing with it, snorkeling, paddle boarding and the list just keeps growing. I recommend this for someone that is adventurous and is always doing something intense to the parent that wants to take video of their kids swimming in the pool. If you want to video and take pictures and just simply not want to worry about anything get this product you will not regret it. I promise!

Reviews.Title: GoPro review
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: This little thing is a awesome camera! When i first got it i couldn't believe! the quality of the camera and its accessories.I own a Kawasaki ZZR600 and you have almost endless camera angles with the mounts provided you can even put it on your helmet which is awesome.The sound quality is outstanding for such a small camera, i was so surprised when i plugged it in the TV for the first time and could actually hear the sound of the engine and not just wind.Downloading to the computer is simple but i ran into trouble when trying to edit it but I'm not as tech-savvy as others, so I'm sure with some help i could do it easy and become a Pro at GoPro camera editing!Over all this thing is great! but i do recommend getting a video editing program and 2 or more 8 gigabyte SD memory cards, depending on how long you wish to film and at what resolutionGoPro for life!

Reviews.Title: Great, cheap, waterproof, camera!
Reviews.Author: natxbrotha
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great so far.  I bought the LCD backpac for it and I believe it is a MUST HAVE.  Navigating the menu without the LCD is like decoding the ancient Egyptian hyrogliphics without a legend or a key.  With the LCD the menu is a breeze!  Plus you can see what your shot is going to be.The GoPro is a fantastic little camera.  It works great when you have a lot of light (outdoors), but the lens isn't super fast so indoors stuff suffers (which is ok with me).  1080p looks good, the 720p60 does great slow motion, and the timelapsing with this is excellent!!!  I timelapsed a motorcycle ride and then a rain storm blowing in and out in the waterproof housing.  I do a lot of timelapsing with my 5D Mark II and this little camera does well for timelapses (in daylight... all auto).

Reviews.Title: quality problem out of the box
Reviews.Author: Pilot and homeowner
Reviews.Content: So far the camera is great, but I've not yet tried it for its main purpose of in-cockpit auto racing.  It solved the problems of the original such as being difficult to start when mounted in out of the way places.  Unfortunately the usb connection was faulty and I'm returning it for another.

Reviews.Title: Size does matter. Small is the new big
Reviews.Author: E. ADEGAS "Joao Adegas"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something simple that could give me good video/audio clips. I didn't want a very low resolution video or one full with blockiness. One important feature that made me choose the GoPro HD Hero was the number of vídeos found not only on their webpage (although demo videos are always done on "perfect" conditions) but the great amount of personal videos available on the web. Being a motorcycle and canoe rider and ascuba diver, this looks by far the best do-it-all camera. Also the amount of accessories available means I don't have to make/improvise ways to set it up on whatever I want to to with it. And in a size that is just right.Once I got it I immediatly used it on a 4 day motorcycle journey. Only able to see how the footage was in the end, I was amazed by the quality, the way to set it up is as basic as point it to where you're going and shoot. Also easy was to turn on and off, start and stop without having to stop my motorcycle. Very good image even with strong vibration like riding in dirt road with my supersport motorcycle. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Easter
Reviews.Content: Wow this is light enough to mount on a kite or an RC airplane and capture great video. I also got the LCD back which is well worth it!. This is a sports cam with a wide view. The video is crisp! Lots of ways to attach this camera.

Reviews.Title: totally awesome, wroth every dollar.
Reviews.Author: J. Schmitt
Reviews.Content: 0the best fun things I've bought, I've used it for riding quads, playing volleyball, SCUBA diving, a dash cam, and tons of random stuff... makes taking the kids to the park look like it was a lot of fun... and with 1080p it looks great to watch, I even bought a second one... wroth every dollar. I edit it with Power Director. love the whole processes, it makes it eazy and fun, and like i actually know what i'm doing, even thought I'm just a dumb ass with a nice camera. thanksmy videos can be seen [...]

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mksurfmaui
Reviews.Content: the camera works awsome! 40 years of surfing and I finally get to film myself without someones help. The quality is superb. The only down point for me was the camera came with NO CHARGER!!! Highly dissapointed, but was able to use the one from my phone. Still very satisfied. thanks go-pro

Reviews.Title: Way too cool!
Reviews.Author: swirt
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday present and I want to steal it!So cool and fun to use.Great image quality, so many way to use it.Water proof case for kayaking and lots of mounts for different uses.We are totally enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Incredible for what it does, could use some tweaks
Reviews.Author: Jeffe Aronson
Reviews.Content: A bit high priced, but incredibly crisp HD video. Final Cut Express doesn't like its format, but that's probably as much to do with FCE being old than anything else, but if you own/use FCE, be prepared to get another program or two to convert, then get high qual slo-mo. Knob to tighten unit to headstraps is clumsy and slow, and it has no telephoto.... so if you're moving and close, as in on a river or bike or whatever, its incredible, but don't expect any shots of that deer or bird. Great product, a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Price
Reviews.Author: Pedro - Brasil
Reviews.Content: This camera amazed me with it's construction quality and video quality recording.The construction is very rough and the camera seens unbreakable when in it's case.I will test the underwater footage, but both internal and external recordings seens very nice on computer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD camera, seems to work better than a ContourGPS
Reviews.Author: Smalldog
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these cameras.  All purchased from Amazon.I have used one of them on an RC airplane (Parkzone Radian), and the video is incredible at 1080p.  I can fly for about 30 minutes with good throttle management due to the added weight.  Without the camera I can fly for about 90 minutes.I have also used the camera in the pool, and the video is pretty good.  I think that really good lighting is needed for underwater video, and that's probably true for any camera used underwater.Just recently purchased the 3D kit and I am anxious to take it out to the pool or maybe even shooting.  Some pretty cool possibilities exist when using this camera anywhere outdoors, not so much indoors.I have had a few videos that would not play when copied to the PC (or Mac), and from my experience I have found that when this is the case, hook the camera up to a TV and play the video.  It seems to "repair" them somehow, then you can copy them to a PC or Mac and watch them.  I wish the same could be said for my ContourGPS which I have yet to use successfully for more than about 20 seconds.  Maybe it's the memory cards I am using, I am not sure, but the HeroHD doesn't really seem too picky about what kind of SDHC cards I use (Class 4 minimum).Amazon seems to have the best price, so make sure you but it "sold by Amazon."  Earlier this week, they were $223, but the price seems to have jumped up to $239.Jeff

Reviews.Title: Video is awesome, sound sucks
Reviews.Author: Carl D. Sickerott
Reviews.Content: Purchased from site and received it in two days.  Absolutely could not wait to try it out, so mounted it inside of windshield.  The videos were far better than I expected from such a small package.  I have tried others and found as you hit bumps the video did a split second freeze, not with this baby.  No matter what bumps, railroad tracks I drove across the video remained stable and viewable.  Almost like I had stabilization.  If you pause your video the paused image looks like it was shot with still camera, it is that clear.  Even driving down the road at 60mph and oncoming traffic at same speed, image is clear, with no motion streaks.  So impressed I immediately ordered the batteryPac and the LCD back Pac.  Now there is the issue, requires firmware upgrade.  Fifteen tries later, I called tech support, he got me up and running in two minutes(way to go guy).  Instructions for firmware upgrade need to mention that the one button recording needs to be in off position before firmware will download from SD card to camera (that is first menu item on setup).I bought this little gem to do some recording while racing my Hobie16 this summer, so wanted to get used to operation of camera, hell now I'm ready to go racing, and boat is not ready.  Will shot everything in 60fs so that if the need arises I can slow down to get split second timing and see where I am going wrong.  Can't wait for first race.  Got to be sure to put lanyard on unit, hate with all this money to have it fall overboard LOL.

Reviews.Title: Birthday present
Reviews.Author: Super Mom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my son's 40th birthday - he is a fisherman, motorcycle rider, camper etc.  he took it motorcycle riding over the weekend and I could not believe the quality of the pictures.  He is thoroughly enjoying it and has convinced me to buy one for my other two sons who enjoy the same sports plus scuba diving.  I can't wait to see those pictures

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Sky Diving
Reviews.Author: Henri Savin
Reviews.Content: I have ordered this camera for a friend of mine who is doing sky diving and needs a small but efficient camera for the job. It takes 1080p videos and can run for a good time before running out of battery.As far as he said, all skydivers are considering this camera as the perfect option because of its tiny size and weight and high performance.

Reviews.Title: GoPro HD HERO
Reviews.Author: S. Harrison
Reviews.Content: Great sport/action camera not a snapshot or general purpose video.  Only wide angle.  Camera also does not float but other then that, I love it.  It can handle a lot of shaking and still keep a stable video. Because of the very wide angle you want to be closer to action then you might think.

Reviews.Title: Awesome - Withstood bone snapping crash on dirt bike
Reviews.Author: DirtRider "I like to play in the dirt"
Reviews.Content: The GoPro Hero HD is fantastic.  It's easy to use,  records wonderful, wide angle footage, comes with a waterproof housing and does pretty well with sound.  I've owned mine for a few years now and It has been in the water recording my surfing as well as a LOT of dirt bike trail riding abuse. I have crashed on it a few times. It has been knocked off my helmet. It has been hit by branches subsequently ejecting me from my bike and is still going strong. Well, the case is going strong. It protects the unit very well.The ONE thing that makes this camera only get 4 stars is it's low light performance. You see, there is none.  You simply cannot get a good video in low light situations and that makes me a little frustrated.  Perhaps they will do better with that in the future. I can only imagine they will. Still, It's a great device and perhaps the best action sports camera that you can get especially for the price. I do recommend that you get an additional battery for the HeroHD if you're going to use it for long events. You don't want to miss out on anything!  Also, get the largest SDcard that you can afford. It's worth it!The raw footage on a big screen LCD TV is just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: A fun camera, but not necessarily a good camera.
Reviews.Author: Debo
Reviews.Content: I had to return my GoPro after only a few recordings, after a couple weeks it developed some strange electrical problem. It began after the camera apparently shorted out when I connected it to my laptop via USB, which is something Ive never seen before. After that it would only power on if you pulled the battery out and put it back in, and would not charge via laptop or turn on when connected. I contacted Amazon for a replacement, and within two days I had another one at my door. We'll see how this new one works. A word to the wise tho, never directly connect the camera to your laptop. To transfer files take out the SD card and used an adapter (or the SD port on your laptop if it has one), and only use a USB wall charger to juice the batteries.Other than that its a decent entry level wearable video camera. For the price you cant beat it. If you really want true HD videos you can share you're going to need a high level video editor (ie. Adobe Premiere, After Effects..), in which case you probably have enough money to afford a better camera anyway. But if you're content using freeware or Windows Movie Maker for ok quality videos then the GoPro will more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: incredible action cam
Reviews.Author: lex
Reviews.Content: Anyone familiar with the GoPro brand already knows this a very high quality product. It's the toughest camera on the market that I'm aware of and probably the most versatile as well. Aside from the superb (daytime) video and photo quality, the wide variety of mounts and accessories for this thing is what makes it such a good purchase for someone seeking an HD actioncam. It is also very easy to use (2-button operation) and is encased in an extremely tough housing. One thing to note is that video/photo quality is not great in bad lighting, at night or indoors...but that's sort of a given as with any camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: skidmark
Reviews.Content: This product is awesome!  I mount the camera on the outside of my up armored vehicle in Iraq when I go on missions.  The quality is very nice for the size and price.  The fisheye lens give a wide field of view allowing me to go over specific points throughout missions for AAR's.I am thinking about buying another for better mission coverage.Needs bigger battery!

Reviews.Title: Great Video, PATHETIC sound
Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great video quality, lots of different quality settings, wide angle lens great for POV photography, EXCELLENT selection of mounting solutions, very rugged and waterproofCons: Sound Quality - are you freakin' kidding me?  It's hard to imagine how bad this camera sounds until you experience it yourself - I thought mine was defective until I talked to other owners.  The sound quality is so bad they should have just left the microphone off altogether.  Two other things are a bit annoying too - the menu system is a bit cryptic and hard to understand (be sure you keep the manual with the camera in case you need to change something), and only a USB cable is provided for charging (be prepared to buy a wall charger if you don't want to wait 4 hours for a full charge).

Reviews.Title: best camera for skydiving!
Reviews.Author: A. Elia
Reviews.Content: Easy to mount on the helmet, high quality, easy to use: simply perfect!

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture/video quality
Reviews.Author: J. Thurber
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome little camera.  Small, lightweight, intuitive controls.I would have rated 5 stars if it came with some editing software.Good job GoPro!

Reviews.Title: Sweet, but brittle
Reviews.Author: Brenden
Reviews.Content: This camera has amazing quality for the price, it shoots great video, but breaks every time I use it. I have broken 2 cases and at least ten mounts, sank one camera.  They can not hold up against any kind of impact and in the action sport world, impact is bound to happen. I use it mainly for wakeboarding and dirt biking, it lasts probably for about two minutes wakeboarding before snapping off and sinking.  The only thing that has kept my last one from the depths of the lake is a piece of pool noodle duct taped to the camera, because the leash they provide snaps off or bends the hinge pin.  For dirt biking you should avoid trees because you'll get to a stopping point take your helmet off only to realize you have no camera anymore. The mounts are crap, the housing is crap, camera is pretty cool, but mounting it in an action sport world just doesn't work, unless you want to spend all your time buying new mounts, cases, and possibly new cameras if it sinks as I had to do.Very disappointing product....

Reviews.Title: Reliable, small, light!
Reviews.Author: echo delta
Reviews.Content: Used a GoProHD for a High Altitude Balloon Project. The little camera was sent up to 100.000 feet with no encasing (didn't want to risk fogging) and exposed to temperatures of -60ºC (-75F). It performed well and the video and audio quality was incredible.We extended the battery life extracting wires from the case battery connectors and rigging the camera to 2 external NB-5L Canon Li-Ion 3.7v 1100 mAH batteries installed in parallel. We got an incredible 21GB of 720p/60 fps video , 2 hours 40m long. The files came in 30min, 4gb each, in h264 and AAC encoding, and haven't had any issues manipulating them with VLC on a Mac.The camera worked extremely well and the video quality was amazing, including the audio (while there was audio to record).See actual footage in the last seconds here:[...].We used it with the 32gb card recommended by GoPro which surprisingly is only class 4... but: whatever works! Kingston 32 GB Class 4 SDHC Flash Memory Card SD4/32GB.My only wishes for this camera are:1) a better UI for the menu -  I don't want a color LCD, extra buttons, or anything that would add weight or reduce the ruggedness of the camera, but the menu system is extremely slow AND laggy and thus hard to navigate. I hope the GoPro folks rethink the menu design in future versions.2) a video mode or lens exchange system to make it less of a fisheye and thus be able to take pictures at with less barrel distortion. Something like 20mm (in 35mm equivalent) would be great.Would recommend and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Compared prices and then bought Motorsport
Reviews.Author: Philip B. Roux
Reviews.Content: I dont need to tell you how awsome the GoPro HD Hero is. I really wanted it. I also wanted the suction cup to connect it to flat surfaces.so i compared the price of the HD Hero Helmet + suction cup to the HD Hero Motorsport + Head strap (the vented helmet strap i didnt want) and found out, that it was cheaper to go with the Motorsport.It seems everyone wants the Helmet, therefore there was a good deal on the Motorsport.Just compare prices before you shop. And the suction cup is just awsome!

Reviews.Title: Irresponsible.
Reviews.Author: Sung Wook Paek
Reviews.Content: I ordered it by mistake while I wanted GoPro Hero 2. Tried to contact the seller for a return, but no response at all. The product seemed also defective in that the recorded video was too dark indoors.

Reviews.Title: PSA: Do Not Take Off the Lithium-Ion Battery When The Camera is Turned On
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I was in a rush and was idiotic enough to take off the battery while the camera was turned on (possibly during recording or standby), and the result was the camera not being to properly function. The camera was still able to be charged, but I was unable to turn it on or have the display pop up. Just a friendly warning.Edit:The reason while I gave this two stars (since people are asking in the comments is) the price to quality isn't that amazing. Look at the Actionpro, that includes an LCD screen, SD card, and a remote control. And it still breaks down for me while the Actionpro is still going strong for me.

Reviews.Title: Unfair customer service policies
Reviews.Author: C. Kehoe
Reviews.Content: This seller on Amazon was fine, and I received the product in a timely manner - but the camera was defective.  Hence, I've been in a month long saga with GoPro customer service to get them to replace the camera, which even they said was just a defective part.  It wouldn't accept an SD card all the way - therefore I have yet to be able to use the camera at all.  Worst of all, GoPro made ME pay to ship the defective camera back to them!  They said they would "make it up to me" with a free mounting accessory, but I don't need an extra mounting accessory, I just need to not pay extra money for an already expensive camera because their parts didn't work.  It is now easily a month after I purchased the camera, two weeks after I shipped the camera back to them, and I haven't yet gotten the replacement in the mail.  Waiting... GoPro email customer service is also incredibly slow.  Email exchanges take a week to get responses, which is why this keeps dragging on.  I finally found a phone number to call and talked to a nice person, but even he wouldn't help with the shipping payment issue, which I think is just absurd.  How can you sell someone a defective piece of hardware and not completely take ownership for the cost of replacing the defective piece?

Reviews.Title: BROKE PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Fernando Pavani
Reviews.Content: My Camera GoPRO came broke. As is try to find the problem i look at the internet and i found a page in facebook with a lot of complaints of the same sort of mine... The phone number of the ASSISTANCE IS TOOOO HARD TO FIND.... the post service is TERRIBLE...

Reviews.Title: Great GoPro
Reviews.Author: J. Fairfax
Reviews.Content: I bought one for each of my grandchildren who are active skiers, dancers, soccer and football players. The used the cameras on Christmas Day. Easy to use, spectacular results. They immediately had lots of ideas on producing video for fun and for school projects. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Not What I Expected
Reviews.Author: Matt Daughtry
Reviews.Content: This isn't a bad camera by any stretch of the imagination. However, it's not clear upfront (or it's very subtle, because I didn't see it even when I went back before writing this review) that your videos will all have a fish-eye effect, where everything bends from the center out to the edges. If that's fine with you, then by all means, this is an ok camera.Also, while the 1080p recording was at that resolution, it seemed like the quality was significantly worse than at a lower resolution. In other words, the lower resolution actually looked nicer than the higher resolution, even when the higher resolution was put in a smaller window.

Reviews.Title: Where's the effing tripod stud?
Reviews.Author: Nick Guadagnoli
Reviews.Content: Every camera in the history of cameras has been made remembering the need to mount it in a stable manner.  Camera manufacturers standardized the stud size and everything.  Who do the makers of this camera think they are, screwing up the bottom of the camera?

Reviews.Title: expect no help from gopro
Reviews.Author: bowhunt8
Reviews.Content: first of all i would like to say the camera worked well and we really liked it but--. my son used this twice and i was downloading videos to our laptop and dropped it about 1 foot on our kitchen table. i really didnt think much of it because i figured these things are tough. later i noticed a scratch on the lens and it was bad, would never thought it would be that bad (done alot worse to my digital cameras with no problems)  but it now shows a bad blur in videos. i knew that it was (my fault) but i figured i would contact gopro for some help. well forget that this company could care less about you after you buy. after i emailed them about problem and asked if there was anyway i could get them to fix or replace the lens (at my cost)  they explained that it was my fault, its not under warranty a scratched lens cant be replaced and they dont fix their cameras. but if i would send them proof of purchase and a pic of the scratch they would see what they could do. i then sent them a pic of the scratch and (my amazon invoice 3 times). i received a great offer . i could pay $10 to send them mine back ,( bought it here for a great price $170 helmet hero). then get the great deal of buying it from them at $202 + $10=$212. so then i would only have $380 in a camera i bought on amazon for $ 170. i wonder if they were gonna throw my returned camera in the trash when they received it back or (replace the the unfixable lens and sell it again)! looks like i have found a good ebayer that will replace it with the genuine gopro lens for $80 . i would think gopro could since they make them but their support told me they dont.  i dont know if the lens in mine was soft or what , i just know it scratches easily. if u buy be very careful when not in the protective housing . or better yet but amazons accident /warranty (i never do but wish i did because if you have a problem gopro does not care, or repair their cameras).

Reviews.Title: Worked once
Reviews.Author: ringneck
Reviews.Content: Recently received the HDHero -set it up tested it and it worked.  The next day it would not power up.  I went to the gopro  website and followed their FAQ on power up issues, but it still would not turn on.  I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Camera wouldn't stay mounted
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I purchased my GoPro excitedly waiting to use it on some motorcycle track days so I could review the footage and critique my body positioning, lean angles, etc. to learn to become a better rider. At the end of the day of my -first- trackday with this camera the thumbscrew loosened somewhere out on the track and the camera came off. I later recovered the camera and the only part which broke was the memory card slot it seems.. during the crash the card was jarred out and now will not load SD cards properly anymore, rendering it useless. I was absolutely sure to check and retighten the screw between every session as I had my doubts as to whether it could stay tight and my concerns were proven. I would absolutely RECOMMEND AGAINST PURCHASING this camera as the mounting system is sub-par and does not include any kind of safety wire/tethering incase it comes off like in my situation. I contacted GoPro support, meticulously detailing with pictures how I mounted the camera, where it was located, etc. and was told that they would not offer me any kind of repairs or replacement under warranty even though I followed the instructions exactly as printed.

Reviews.Title: GoPro needs to update its cameras
Reviews.Author: Freezer Boy
Reviews.Content: Let's say that the camera works & it can shoot nice video under ideal conditions but it's far from perfect. The fishbowl lens is a real minus if there is any up & down movement; less so if you're moving side to side & maintaining a fairly constant horizon in the center of your frame. Many manufacturers have the wide-angle fishbowl lens but GoPro's really distorts the image in a bad way. The overall video quality doesn't impress me, it's just OK.If you wear a head harness while rock climbing (H.H. is not available with the motorsports package -- but available), you will probably end up with annoying video. If you wear a head harness while driving, you'll be happier with the results because your focus doesn't change as often. Sometimes what you're shooting makes all the difference, or what resolution you choose, or how well the image is illuminated. While you'll get better at compensating for the cameras limitations the more you use it, you're still left with the fact that this camera doesn't do as good a job as cameras from other manufactures when it comes to video quality and manual adjustments.For example, I had a Sony TX7 that took far nicer videos & pictures and it cost the same. Of course, the TX7 isn't made for the same purpose as the GoPro but given the added feature set of the TX7 and the utter lack of features on the GoPro camera, one would think that the GoPro company would have put forth a product with superior video. Video with shadows and bright objects in the same frame rarely looks nice from any manufacturer of sub $300 cameras - some part of the image is lost - but the GoPro lags behind others in high-contrast situations, and in video smoothness & sharpness.The suction mount is worthless--most are. The suction cup wouldn't hold to any surface. I glued the suction mount's base to a plate with a bolt extending out from the base which was then attached to a magnet which was then mounted to my truck's roof. The magnet should not be near the camera. So all was not lost on the suction mount. I'd rather have the chest harness for motorsports than the suction cup. The helmet mounts work very well.The camera's controls are simple, and as many have pointed out, something out of the 1980's in terms of interface design. I knew this going in and was happy to trade it for a longer battery life. However, if your eyesight is poor you won't much like the interface design. Icons are super small and the LCD can be hard to read. I wanted a camera with a long battery life, quality video, and a bulletproof design. GoPro isn't quite there but your POV waterproof action camera options are fairly limited. And, GoPro has a good dealer network for buying supplies like extra batteries & mounts.The mounting selections have held up to my abuse (except the suction cup). I have a head & chest harness and a tripod mount. The camera's housing is a little disappointing as is the camera (seems cheaply made -- hard to say since I haven't had it long enough to pass fair judgement). I always feel like I'm going to break the plastic case when I shut it. The silver nut that accepts the mounting bolt fell out of my head harness mount. I made the mistake of assuming the nut was permanently attached to the mounting plate. It wasn't. That's a design flaw IMO. Friends have complained about the underwater video that the camera produces. I have yet to try the underwater shooting. I don't trust the GoPro housing to protect the camera because of statements on the instruction sheet suggesting that the slightest grain of sand in the door can lead to water damage.I want that bulletproof camera with outstanding POV video--GoPro hasn't built it, yet.

Reviews.Title: The mount doesn't swivel.
Reviews.Author: Kevin Mahler
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these and a Contour camera at the same time.  I'm returning the GoPro for one main reason.  The mount can only be pointed in one direction!  The Contour suction mount has a ball link that allows the camera to be pointed in any direction.  The GoPro mount can only point in one of two directions.  The other plus to the Contour is that the lens (sensor) can be rotated 180 degrees so if the camera is mounted sideways, you can still record the video vertically.

Reviews.Title: Surf Hero HD
Reviews.Author: Scott J
Reviews.Content: It was delivered quickly which was great because I was leaving on a surf trip to Central America. The camera works great. One thing I would like added to the surf hero kit, is multiple board mounts. Having to purchase separately for $20 is a but much. Once we did some filming, everyone wanted it on their board! The wide angle lens only works mounted to the board. Filming from a boat or in the water leaves the subject too far away.Great quality shots from your board!

Reviews.Title: The best Video capture device for Movements
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Al Obaidli "Alobaidli"
Reviews.Content: you will never find such a device that can be mounted any where whether you want to capture your car driving skills or any movement scenes .. the build is excellent and there are many accessories available

Reviews.Title: I RETURNED PRODUCT AND NEVER GOT A REFUND
Reviews.Author: Cherish Butler
Reviews.Content: I asked if I could return the camera as my husband had already purchased one and didn't need it. They gave me an address and I sent it back and after waiting over a month and not hearing anything back I messeged the seller multiple times and he just gave me the run around saying he would look for it, but would never get back to me so I would message him again with still no response.  So now I am out over $250  on a product that I don't even have anymore as I mailed it back months ago.  I can't even sell it to get some of my money back. DON'T EVER BUY ANYTHING FROM THIS COMPANY AS THEY ARE CHEAP AND STEAL YOUR MONEY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great cam
Reviews.Author: Ari
Reviews.Content: I've used this off an on over the past few years and it still works perfectly. The "motorsports mount" works great but I can't help but worry about it flying off while driving. I've only used that mount a dozen or so times. I've more frequently used the GoPro for mountain biking and recording wildlife. I'm not sure if the new models have motion activation but it would be a great feature. Place this on your bird feeder for some great up close footage of those beautiful birds. :)

Reviews.Title: GoPro HD
Reviews.Author: Sticky
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera, I like the versatility of all the mounting options. This is my 2nd GoPro. My first one died. (Won't turn on.and yes I've tried to reset / new batteries / cables.)

Reviews.Title: For review of go pro camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Only the camera showed up. No manual or instructions.  The powere cords were split and freyed. I was not pleased when I went to purchase other accessories

Reviews.Title: GoPro is the best
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: I gave this 4 stars because it's the standard GoPro 3 black, not the 3+. I really think GoPro should have fixed the issues with battery and wireless before releasing. When I bought it I thought I got a good deal but did not realize that the 3+ was out, which solved those issues.

Reviews.Title: Item shipped had been opened and is damaged
Reviews.Author: David L. Coons
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a xmas gift and had it gift wrapped by Amazon - upon gift being received it had appeared that the GoPro packaging had been opened before due to the poor taping job and assembly which meant that it likely wasn't factory new. Got the SD card later and it wouldn't snap into place as it should, as it appears the internals are damaged - spring in SD port was popped out (which is likely why it was repackaged and sold again). Camera has not been used once and has been a huge disappointment. Due to the return policy with the seller I cannot return the camera now and am working to warranty it with GoPro directly unless the seller would like to fix this. Hopefully I will get something that works although it is going to cost me more.Other issues I found annoying beyond camera being "new" and not working include:Shipping was supposed to happen Christmas Eve - didn't happenGoPro Hero version is old (v1 vs v3) yet being sold at same price as new version.

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: RR
Reviews.Content: I love the go Pro. The videos are clear. The audio is clear and it records for a long time I use it on my bicycle and I get a lot of compliments. If a car runs into me again. I will have it on film. That way I can get the driver arrested and I can sue his insurance company, so he can't afford to drive anymore. You know how that goes when you recording it. They don't do anything wrong.

Reviews.Title: I am a hero!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic but not friendliest
Reviews.Author: Bridget Royston
Reviews.Content: I love using my GoPro only because I really like the end results.  I like that it is shielded to the wind noise and that it is also waterproof. I can say, however, that it isnt all that user friendly. There isnt a label for which button is which...a simple on/off or stop/record.  The digital read outs have abbreviations for what they are but doesnt seem intuitive to me at all.  I usually have to relearn it when I go to use it again after several months have gone by. Anytime I give it to someone to use it is training all over again.With all that being said, the small hassle of learning it is well worth it due to a very reliably great picture considering the different resolutions and angles offered.  I believe the new 3 addresses some of my complaints....still a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Product!

Reviews.Title: Camera Died after 18 Months!
Reviews.Author: Ernie Bautista
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on Oct 18, 2011 prior to a vacation in Costa Rica. I used it while on vacation and occasionally during 2012 on some bike trails with no issues. Forward to May 2013. Going to Cabo in a week and decided to get the camera ready. Started to charge and the light went off after an hour of charging. I try to turn it on and it won't. Called GoPro and they suggested to get a new battery. Purchased one and got the same result. Called GoPro again and they opened a case stating that the camera probably went bad and asked for the serial number and original invoice (thank god for Amazon!). I receive an email later that day stating that since the camera is out of the 1 year warranty, they could not replace it. The best they can do is give me a 20% discount off any camera purchase off their website. This is only after I send them the camera only, no battery, SD card, or accessories. I told them I would like to get a H3 but they couldn't guarantee that I would be able to get one before I left next week. So I bought a H3 Black from Amazon and I'm in the process of purchasing a 3 yr warranty also.I really like these cameras and I'm a little disappointed at GoPro that their product couldn't last a couple of years with very little use. Hopefully I'll have better luck with the H3.

Reviews.Content: I bought this thinking it was a Hero2. the functions are clunky and the icons are too small to see while scuba diving

Reviews.Title: Great camera when it works
Reviews.Author: M. Jensen "MJ"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great in good light but does not perform very well in low lighting conditions. The waterproof case is great and works very well underwater.The one gripe I have with this camera is the quality and reliability.After less than three months the battery went bad. Rather than exchange the battery, GoPro replaced the camera with a refurbished one instead of a new camera.Consequently I ended up with a used camera that conked out less than a year after that. I called GoPro and since it was out of warranty, they offered me 20% off of a newer model. While it is better than nothing I just don't think that a 20% discount is sufficient for a camera that barely lasts a year. If I had been using it daily it would have been palatable but I only used it when I flew on long trips every 6 weeks or so.So for a camera that has seen very little use it really should last more than a year.My next camera will be a Sony, while not as versatile at least the quality is there.

Reviews.Title: Great HD Video
Reviews.Author: Bill Streb
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the world of HD video recording, in a super small package.  I use this mostly to record my high performance boating experiences, and would say the quality of the video is outstanding.  It has good battery life, and with a larger memory card, it will take more video than I need to shoot of any one event.  The only slight weirdness, is that when using the suction cup mount, I have noticed  what I would call, for lack of a better term, waviness in the video image. It looks like the vibration coming through to the camera is causing the image to be unstable.  Not in a “shakey” way, more like the image is fluidly changing slightly.  But, the waterproof housing, and excellent mounting options make this such a good product, that if asked, I couldn’t even tell you who else makes a similar product.  It doesn’t matter, because this one is that good.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth D. Wallace
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how light and small this camera is.The clarity of the picture is unmatched by any camera I have ever owned. Great outdoor action camera!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera For Good Times
Reviews.Author: Jeff Payne "Call me Jeff....."
Reviews.Content: My name is Jeff Payne and I've always been an adrenaline junkie.  I've tried to film the shenanigans that me and my friends get into but I've always ended up ruining my camera, dropping it in cave water, cracking it longboarding, shattering it while cliff diving, etc....  I just got married to a beautiful and sweet lady who can actually put up with my nonsense and she decided to get me a GoPro for Christmas.  This thing can take the abuse that I hand out.  It can go to those crazy places with me and I'm not in fear of ruining it.  I absolutely love the different settings that you can use on it, although it does take a bit of time to learn all of the abbreviations as the screen is tiny.  I love the wide angle lens and I always film stuff using the R3 setting (720p at 60 Frames Per Second)  This camera is perfect for stupid people like myself! I just got back from the Bahamas and I tried to film everything I could with it in many different settings, snorkeling, swimming, hiking, etc.  If anyone is interested in seeing the footage it's on my youtube channel.  You can see it here.  youtube.com/callmejeff86  The video is called "Let's Take A Cruise"Nevertheless, I haven't had any errors happen to me with this device.  I do recommend getting some anti fog inserts to go with you on snorkeling, snow, or intense heat trips.  So pick it up, get out there, and take on the world!Jeff Payne Approved

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: Got for my hubby and he loves it. Uses for bike rides and whatever else he wants to video tap

Reviews.Title: Great, but a warning for divers!
Reviews.Author: Daffy
Reviews.Content: The video/picture quality of this camera lives up to all the 5 star reviews that I have read. It is excellent- ABOVE water. With the original housing you do get a blurry and sometimes out of focus picture when it is submerged. That's almost common knowledge. However, here's the warning. My first dive trip with the camera in it's original housing (not the dive housing) was between 50-75 feet. Down at depth, the pressure compressed the rubber seal enough to where the top latch would free itself. The water pressure was enough to hold the back door closed of course... until I surfaced and didn't realize it wasn't latched. The result was an unlatched housing half full of seawater. I immediately dumped the water out, removed the battery and gave it a rinse with fresh water when I got back to the beach. Luckily GoPro2 is built sturdy enough that after a few days of sitting in desiccant, it dried out and still worked.

Reviews.Title: Best money I've ever spent.

Reviews.Content: I mounted this to my surfboard every time I go out. The video quality is phenomenal. The waterproof case works great. The difference between the Hero2 and 3 is that the 1st one does not come with wifi (not that big of a deal) so you have to actually plug it into a computer or tv (again, whoopdy doo). And the 3 has slightly better quality, but no one but professionals can tell.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera, GREAT support and service!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I've used my GoPro HD Hero on land and when SCUBA diving and always been happy with the results.  I recently bought the new dive housing and on the very first use it leaked and the camera and the battery BacPack were ruined.  A quick correspondence (and submitting a camera serial number and purchase proof) with GoPro resulted in them sending me a new camera, dive housing, and battery BacPack, even before I returned the damaged one to them (and without asking for a credit card deposit). Their service is one of the best I've encountered, and will enjoy the dive housing that removes the underwater soft focus problem.If you need a non-zoom video camera (also capable of still photos) to capture wide-angles (several angles selectable) in hi-def, any of the Hero cameras will nicely fill the bill.  To have them waterproof to 180 ft while diving is a real plus as well, and the ability to record for 1-2 hours at a time in such a small package is unique.

Reviews.Title: A must have for any family!
Reviews.Author: Pampered Prepper
Reviews.Content: Ive had this GoPro for close to a year now, and my family and I just love it. Since it includes easy to apply mounts for attaching the camera to lots of different helmets you can use it for plenty of diffrrent activities. Our family enjoys using it while ridding our dirt bikes, we have really gotten some awsome footage! As far as using it, I found it pretty easy to figure out. However if you do have a hard time with it you can can access a ton of different instructional videos online.That brings up another issue that isn't huge but could be an issue for a few,  ( or gift wise) you really need to have a computer to fully enjoy this HD hero camera. You can however charge it without one if you have the correct adapted.The camera itself comes with ; a waterproof /shockproof housing,a head-strap mount,6 different helmet mounts and a rechargeable lithium battery.So regardless of what your doing be it snowboarding, surfing,MX, wake boarding or even horse back riding,make sure you to take your GoPro! Its worth every penny trust me.

Reviews.Content: First of all the camera takes really good video, especially considering it's size. The camera was much smaller than I was expecting it to be (when outside it's case) and light weight. I have a contourHD as well and the color's on this are a bit more vivid. Reviews.Title: GoPro

Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that takes superb pictures! The video is great, too--especially when attached to vehicles in motion!

Reviews.Title: Extremely excellent product!

Reviews.Title: Great little addition to my gear
Reviews.Author: Tim Brueggemann
Reviews.Content: I bought the GoPro mainly for my skiing adventures and am very pleased with the camera overall. It captures great video, even the colors are pretty decent.I would love to film in 1080p but since it will give me a wide yet flat picture, I prefer the 960p resolution for most situations. It just gives you a bigger picture and it's not as easy to miss the perfect angle (which can happen in 1080p and then you end up just filming the tip of your skis or just the sky).The stickers to glue the camera mount to your helmet have held very well so far. I have landed on my helmet a few times and the camera still sits tightly up there. Really cool stuff!Excited to try it out in new areas soon, like on a JetSki, Quad, Skidiving etc. Perfect for those things!Major downside: the picture function requires a real stable hand (head in this case), as they can come up blurry otherwise. Takes some getting used to, but then it is a great addition to filming all the time and just taking a scenic photograph every once in a while.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my GoPro

Reviews.Content: The GoPro is a lot of fun and I enjoy shooting video's of my runs or bike rides.  It's somewhat limited, but with some practice trying different settings, you can get a lot of joy and good use out of this video camera.

Reviews.Title: OK, but nothing special
Reviews.Author: willyB
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a year. I use it on motorcycle rides mainly.The good: Waterproof, dustproof, lots of mounts, case is very solid, fairly easy to operate with one handThe bad: Wind noise is horrible with either backing. Cant hear anything but wind over 20mph. Video quality is not great for a $300 video-camera. Wide angle is achieved with a "fishbowl" lens that distorts everything. Pictures are horrible because of distortion and 5MP cheap sensor. Difficult to achieve proper alignment when on a helmet. Handlebar mount broke, luckily plastic case is tough. case fogs up in rain or high humidity, or low temperatures, with either backing on. Video is often grainy, or pixelated, or go in and out of focus when moving quickly, even in bright sunlight, on either 720p or 1080. Go pro is about even with my $70 kodak easyshare sport, but the kodak takes better photos and they are not walleye. Some sd cards it will not read for no apparent rhyme or reason. Sandisk 8gb class 6 wouldnt work, another sandisk 4gb class 4 does. Ordered it with a transcend 32gb class 10, that wouldnt work in go pro, but worked perfectly in any other camera. ?Conclusion: It does take video in extreme conditions and videos are fun to watch. I have not used any other helmet cams, that may be better or cheaper. My video opinions are based on point and shoot cameras that take better video. Cool idea but could and should be better for 300 dollars.

Reviews.Title: Go Pro helmet cam
Reviews.Author: Wildbill
Reviews.Content: Got this for our son for Christmas and he really loves it!  He will use it when he goes snowmobiling on his vacation!

Reviews.Title: Good action camera system
Reviews.Author: sre7
Reviews.Content: There isn't much that already hasn't been said about this camera and it's system.  It is well known and almost a standard in reality and sport TV and video.  This system is great.  The mount, the case, the quality of the pieces is great.  Wish there was a standard viewfinder or display on the unit to help aim it.  Maybe they need to include a set of aiming lasers that helps you aim where the camera is looking, like one of their competitors has done.Sometimes the 1080p video quality is really quite good.  Sometimes it is just not sharp.  When it get lower light, the camera must be adjusting the aperature, decreasing the depth of field and the image becomes less sharp.  I really don't like the "less sharp" images of the lower light video.  I have even looked into replacing the front bubble lens case cover with some of the flat aftermarket lens covers...which are intended to help the underwater focus issue, but haven't seen any discussion on if these new, after market lens covers help when on ground and not underwater.I sent a note to Gopro customer support and asked about the problem with non-sharp video and all I got was an email asking for as sample of the image.  They know of the problem and just try to push the problem back on the customer.  Not cool!  They need to just acknowledge the issue and come up with some solutions.

Reviews.Title: go pro

Reviews.Content: the camera shipped very quickly and arrived many days before christmas. the price was much better on amazon than any other site i looked at

Reviews.Title: The gift that keeps giving

Reviews.Content: I purchased the original GoPro for my husband last year and he has not stopped using it since. Reviews.Content: Out of all the cameras I had this has to be the one yet. I already tested the water poof in an indoor swimming pool place and it worked great! Reviews.Title: Not user friendly
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Tonsing
Reviews.Content: The first thing you will notice is that the instructions are terrible. There are lots of things left out, which you'll need to figure out on your own. For instance, how does one remove the "removable water proof door," to get better sound? There is a hinge pin, but it is wedged in there pretty tight. And the instructions for downloading to your computer are cryptic at best. I have been just removing the SD card and plugging it directly into my PC. It's easy to preview the files in Windows Media Viewer.Also, Go Pro is incredibly cheap, as far as what is left out. No battery charger is included, so if you don't happen to be next to your computer for four hours, you are out of luck. You have to charge it using the USB cable hooked to a computer. I'll bet a charger could have been made for about $3. They could have included a 1 or 2 GB SD card, but they didn't. If you don't happen to have one lying around, you will be frustrated when trying to use the camera out of the box. They are pretty stingy with mounting hardware too. You'll need to harvest part of the packaging mount to use some of the other mounts. I also found a nut was missing in one of the brackets.Aiming the camera is hit or miss. There is no LCD view screen at all, so you just have to guess on the aiming, and hope for the best. A useful accessory would be a small LCD screen that attaches with Velcro to your jacket, and plugs into the camera's USB port. I'm not aware of this being available.Sound is very muted if you are using the water proof back. I have not been able to change backs yet, because the hinge pin won't budge with a paper clip, so I don't know what the sound is like with the other back.Changing settings is so complicated, you will want to set and forget, or else bring along the instruction sheets so you can figure it out. If you are used to DSLRs and pro video cameras, as I am, you will find the tiny front LCD readout to be extremely cryptic.Overall, I think several generations, and a dozen improvements down the road, and at about a $175 price point, this will be a much more desirable camera.

Reviews.Title: Could be better, but good overall
Reviews.Author: Jim in Washington State
Reviews.Content: Camera provides excellent view and recording quality. A little to hard to see the screen for your options of what your recording. when turning it on with racing gloves on, somehow have recorded all the images upside down, worked right the first few times then upside down the next few times. I'm sure I'll figure it out, but there's got to be a better way to indicate your settings.Don't trust the "cheezy" mounts available from these guys for motorsport use. Anyone with a real race car will be sorely disappointed in the quality of their attempt. For as many of us in the motorsport community are supporting this company, they have not seemed to reciprocate well with making it easy to buy from racing suppliers. Reviews.Author: G. Parker
Reviews.Content: OK, so I'm not an extreme sports person, but I still have uses for this camera and find it very entertaining.  Uses I have found for it so far include the obvious such as putting it on my helmet while mountain biking, but also the less obvious such as hand hold it zooming around my house low to the ground for fun videos, set it up to record a sunrise and sunset in time lapse photo mode, filming inside a fish tank, and also holding it out the window of a car while someone else is driving. Reviews.Title: Awesome rally camera
Reviews.Author: ClLy
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera for capturing video in the rally car. Although I need to change the setting for night racing as the light picked up on the default setting isn't very good so I was suggested by the company for night time to switch the exposure settings to the other value and see how it goes. Reviews.Title: The best out there
Reviews.Author: kkrome25 "kkrome25"
Reviews.Content: Wearable, point-of-view video cameras are, in my opinion, a fairly new product. A lot of the current offerings leave a lot to be desired in terms of image quality, user interface ease and dependability. As a system, this is the best, offering the greatest variety of accessories for whatever activity you pursue. The accessories are very useful, especially the wrist mount for me. The menu navigation takes some time to get acquainted with, and the letters may appear to look like numbers and vice-versa. The red light should be behind the camera, or on top, so the videographer does not have to turn the lens on himself to see the red light blinking. For its size, the camera and housing is understandably heavy. I've tried to use it mounted on a radio-controlled airplane, and the camera is too heavy for most planes less than 60 inches in wingspan.  I wish Go Pro would make a smaller camera, or half the weight. I would definitely purchase a lighter and smaller camera. But the Go Pro HD is very useful and handy, once you get used to navigating its menu and basic operation.

Reviews.Title: Best of the cheap action cams
Reviews.Author: LA Photo Ltd "Photographer"
Reviews.Content: Video quality is king... and this camera as of Oct 2011 is still the king in terms of picture quality. Now having said that, it is pretty bad compared to a DSLR shooting 720p and certainly 1080p, but of all the cheap action cams out there, this one delivers usable video with the best overall quality.For shooting in a car, get the skeleton case (holes on sides) so you can have the mic working and so that you can plug USB into it to recharge in the car. For shots mounted to exterior of the car, use the waterproof case as that will cut down on wind noise and will ensure less damage if the camera drops off the cat at speed.Get the 2 suction cup mount Delkin Devices DDMOUNT-SUCTION Fat Gecko Double Knuckle Dual Suction Cup Camera Mount to minimize change of suction failing. Also get the GoPro tripod 1/4 20 mount to use with standard tripod mounts.Back video screen is nice for composing shots (so you don't film a fender instead of a tire)

Reviews.Title: Perfection

Reviews.Content: I searched far and wide for a camera that would hold up to the abuse I would potentially put it through. Normally when I spend anything over a hundred dollars I get buyers remorse, but with this camera I only had wished I bought it sooner! You actually get addicted to using it... I need to go to GoPro Anonymous.

Reviews.Title: Everyone needs one
Reviews.Author: FSAE
Reviews.Content: I think I have recorded something almost every day I have had it. In this time period I have learned a lot about this HD camera.First off it took me about a year to finally muster up the strength to buy. Using the Camelizer extension on Chrome, I waited until the price had dropped to around $220-230.Day 1: Rode around town and campus recording everything I could to see how the video would look. In this test phase I learned that you cannot hold it the camera with your hand. The video will look like you were having a seizure. Later that night I decided to go out to the bars to record my night just to make sure I wouldn't forget anything. Turns out that the GOPRO is terrible in the dark. Obviously you need light to get a good shot with any camera, but I didn't think it would be that bad. I couldn't make out anything that had been recorded.After a few weeks of playing around with the different camera setting such as 1080i or the 60fps 720 I found my favorite setting. I leave it on the 3 setting (720) due to its resistance to frame shutter and being able to throw it into Twixtor and pumping out some super slow-mo. 1080i is overrated compared to slow mo in my honest opinion.I was able to take the camera into the ocean and play around with it. Turns out it really is waterproof and takes wonderful footage.Haven't seen any issues with the salt water effecting the seals or hazing on the plastic. Looks like the engineernerds did their job!As for the camera, the same thing applies for the video. It needs to be mounted or steadied to something for an un-blurry picture. You may get lucky and snap one stable picture, but most will be faulty.There is an auto-x coming up this weekend and I look forward to using the suction cup to get some sick shots underneath the car or the suspension. Also looking forward to driving the FSAE car and get a POV shot of the race.Overall I'm happy with the camera. Sadly it can only be used in extremely bright light.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Meagan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my boyfriend for the upcoming ski season. We both snowboard and thought this would be really fun for capturing jumps and stuff. We went out to Aspen last year with another couple and they had the GoPro helmet and it was awesome, at the end of the day we got to watch the video of our day on the mountain. It also inspired us to try things we might not normally try- made the day of skiing/snowboarding that much more interesting and exciting. I can't really attest to durability because I have yet to see a major wipeout with the GoPro, but the case it comes in seems pretty legit, and you can apparently fix it to a surfboard too, so i'm assuming its gotta be pretty durable, since its made for somewhat "extreme" usage. Its fairly easy to use, but because its so small alot of the setup stuff has to be done via tv or computer, since there is no screen on the actual camera. So far its looking pretty awesome, but haven't really tested it out enough to spot potential negatives.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price, few issues
Reviews.Author: M. Peezick "Quality > Quantity"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for paintball games.  I got it with the Helmet Hero system, which came with a variety of mounts, including the one I currently use, the headstrap. The video quality is good, full HD, and the view from the 1080p resolution has far less distortion than some of the other resolutions (although I wish I had control of just how much).  It is durable, small and lightweight.  Not the smallest or the lightest of the many action cameras out there, but is easy to use and mount, especially from a first person perspective (I hate side-view perspectives).The menus take a while to go through, but I don't expect to use most of the options, so its not a huge deal.  I set it up ahead of time, and then I just have to hit record.  Battery life is decent, although I wish it was longer.  I will definitely need to buy another battery.  The price is good, right there with the many other options out there, and cheaper than many others as well. Audio is decent, and I know its not the usual focus of these kinds of products, but I hope future models incorporate better microphones, just to keep putting GoPro past the competition, since I think sound is important along with image clarity.  The one bad thing about the video is that the camera isn't the fastest out there with regards to focusing or adapting to change light, so there will sometimes be wavy distortion, odd coloring, or overly bright lighting at times, although not for very long.  I know some of this is due to the technology itself, but something that can be improved upon in the future.Overall, I looked at a lot of similar products for months, contemplating all the advantages to each, differences between, pricing, future models, accessories, etc, and I bought this one overall all others, and I'm glad I did.  Not that it means much to whomever reads my reviews, but I've noticed over the years that many of my friends and family tend to look to me on product advice, whether asking directly to advise them on a product they should buy, or simply buying the same thing I've bought.  They know I put a lot of time and thought into these sorts of things, and they've never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not just for the Pros.

The baseplate it comes with is actually a mount. It also comes with an extra back door for better sound quality, but it is not waterproof when you use that back door.

Reviews.Title: GoPro camera really works
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: I got this to capture my motorcycle rides and it is absolutely perfect for that task.  The wide angle view works well here, but not if you want to see things the way your eye sees them. The human eye has a built in digital zoom effect which the camera cannot match.  Not much at low light either, but if daytime road shots, or self shots are in order, you cannot beat this camera. Oh, did I say it can handle rain?  I don't worry about this camera getting wet. Very very cool.

Reviews.Title: Amazing cam

Reviews.Content: The Gopro HD Camera is Amazing, I put one on a superbike and film a crash at 100 mph, whitout a scratch. See that on [...].

Reviews.Title: Sweet mountable camera
Reviews.Author: snowboarder
Reviews.Content: This camera is so sweet. I mainly bought it for snowboarding but since its not winter yet I haven't got to use it for that yet. I have used it for mountain biking and it works great. Its not quite as stable as it looks on commercials but I'm sure thats just a matter of running it through the right editing software. For mountain biking I've found the 720p @ 60fps works best. There is just too much shaking in the camera for the 1080p mode. 1080p looks great on smooth surfaces though like on the street or side walk. I'm very impressed with how clear the picture is even with flying over rough terrain. I can't wait to use it on the snow. My two lowest ratings were for the ease of use and the sound quality. Ease of use was because the menu system can be confusing and hard to navigate especially if you don't have the LCD screen. With the screen its a bit easier but still takes forever to get through the menues and if you miss what you were looking for you have to scroll all the way back through.  These issues are only a problem when you are trying to use other modes. Since I typically just shoot video and don't switch resolutions that often this isn't much of an issue since I just always leave it in the same mode and just start or stop recording wich is done by just hitting the shutter button on the top. I do wish there was a easier and faster away to change the camera modes and also the resolution but that would probably make the camera bigger and I would rather keeping the clunky menu system to keep it the size it is. The other low score I gave it was for sound and thats only because I have a back ground in sound recording. So compared to high end sound equipment its not that good. But compared to other little video cameras this is the best I have ever heard. Even with the full water proof case I'm still amazed how well the sound comes out. If you don't need the camera to be water proof and your at speeds less then 100mph the open back doors are the best way to go. It picks up voices from pretty far away and they are pretty clear. Even while moving the mic does a great job at reducing wind noise. On play back I can still here conversations even while moving. With the full water proof housing you do have to be pretty close to the camera to be able to hear anything but it does even better as far as wind noise. I was flying down a mountain bike trail the other day and I couldn't hear any wind.The accessories made for this camera are plentiful. There are so many ways to mount this camera. The sticky mounts seem really secure as long as its a smooth and clean surface. I tried mounting them to my car dash and it just wont stay. Its because my dash is bumpy and the sticky tape just doesn't stick well to this kind of surface. If you get the tripod adapter then that opens even a bigger world of mounting and stand options. Even know the mounts all seem secure and strong I like to have my camera tethered just incase they fail in some way. I do this simply with some fairly thick fishing line. Doesn't have to be super thick but its thicker then average. Just tie it to the camera and the other end to your helmet, car, bike ext... Its just a safe guard because I would hate loosing this 300 doller toy. All in all I love this camera and would recommend it to anyone looking for a wearable camera to capture there favorite sports. I find myself always wanting to record everything now. Its so great to be able to capture all those enjoyable moments in such a small package.  I love this camera!
